loans.name: Hauwa Yusuf

texts.en: Hauwa Yusuf is a 32-year-old farmer from Ikara.  As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa Yusuf is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hauwa Yusuf can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. With access to high quality inputs, Hauwa Yusuf could reap up 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. Hauwa Yusuf is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Najib and  Zayyad. Hauwa Yusuf’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Richco Group

texts.en:
Richco's group is composed of four hard-working members. They sell materials, general goods, canopy leather and groceries. Emmanuel is 65 years old and lives with his wife in the town of Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. For the past forty years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his retail materials shop at his residence. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of GHS 2,000. The loan will be used to purchase more materials to sell and will help Emmanuel generate greater profits and take care of himself and his wife. Emmanuel hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a good life. 

They will take this loan from ID-Ghana and also receive group training from the micro finance institution. They will need a total amount of GHS 5,100 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to sell

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: Jose Daniel, mayor de edad casado con un hijo menor de edad,con discapacidad y no estudia, el cual esta bajo su responsabilidad,de origen chinandegano ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística, es un microempresario y administrador de sus propios negocios el cual consiste en un puesto de relojería ubicado en uno de los mercados de esta localidad donde ofrece el servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de relojes, veta de repuestos de estos como:fajas, baterías, pines, terminales, agujas entre otros sus compras las realiza al contado a proveedores de otro departamento, tambien tiene una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diario como: granos básicos, productos congelados, detergentes, golosinas, entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras, camiones distribuidores y mercados de esta localidad las cuales son al contado sus ventas en ambos negocios son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, negocio el cual tiene mas de 35 años de dedicarse a este tipo de servicio, no es primera vez que ha trabajado con león 2000 sino que tiene un buen récord crediticio en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma,uno de sus sueños es poder crecer en sus negocios,realizar ciertas mejoras en su hogar para lograr brindarle un cuarto mejor acondicionado a su hijo con discapacidad, por lo que hoy en día Jose Daniel esta solicitando nuevamente un financiamiento para invertir en sus negocios en la compra de activo fijo e invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos,detergentes, golosinas, productos congelados entre otros mas, Jose Daniel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jose Daniel is married and has one son in his care, who has a disability and doesn't go to school. They are from Chinandego, located in the western part of the country, an area noted for its commercial and touristic productivity.  Jose Daniel owns and runs his own small businesses. One is a watch shop located in one of the markets in his area. He repairs and maintains watches, and sells parts such as straps, batteries, pins, terminals, needs, and more. He has a purchase account from vendors in another department.

He also runs a small grocery where he sells everyday consumer goods such as staple grains, frozen foods, detergents, candies, and more. He purchases his goods on account from distributors, truck distributors, and markets throughout the area.  For both businesses, he has both steady and sporadic customers. He has more than 35 years of experience in this line of work. This isn't the first time he's worked with León 2000, and he has a good credit history, having demonstrated responsibility in making his payments on time. 

Among his dreams are growing his businesses and making some improvements to his house, such as providing a room in better condition for his disabled son. That's why Jose Daniel is seeking this loan today, so that he can make an investment in purchasing fixed assets and other capital for his work, such as household consumables. Jose Daniel is grateful to Kiva investors for helping people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua and providing them a chance to earn a dignified living.

loans.use: stock both his watch business and his grocery store

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 5 children ages 11, 9, 7, 5 and 2 years. Four are school-going children. He has one additional fostered dependent who lives with him.  

In 2002, Mohamed established his soft and hard drinks business - wine, gin, tonic, punch, etc. He began his business because he got his initial capital from palm oil proceeds, which he used to start a grocery business; he later changed it to drinks.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy crates of wine, tonic, gin and soft drinks. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to develop his piece of land, improve his palm oil plantation, and educate his children. This loan will help to generate more income, but debtors are not paying their debts on time.  He is an ambitious and hardworking business man.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy crates of wine, tonic, gin and soft drinks

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 46 years old. She is married with six children between 22 and 7 years old. All of them go to school. She has been selling in a shop and has been working for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, soap, salt and sweets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees, improve their standards of living and savings.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, soap, salt and sweets to sell

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 26 years old. She is married with three children between 6 years and 10 months old. Two of them go to school. She sells sorghum and has been working for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy foodstuffs and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en:
Domithile is age 42. She is married with seven children, ages between 22 and 11 years.  Two of them go to school. 

She sells clothes, and has been selling for the two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy domestic animals and food stuffs.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 36 years old. He is married with 7 children between the ages of 17 and 4 years; all of them go to school. 

He has been selling in a shop, and has been running a business for the past 13 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as salts, sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy land and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as salts, sugar, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 53 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 14 and 3 years; all of them go to school. 

He sells clothes, and has been selling for the past 20 years. 

With the loan, Faustin would like to buy more clothes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to buy food stuffs.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 55 years old, married, and the father of eight children between 29 and seven years of age, all of whom go to school. Jean has been selling pumps for the past 20 years. With this loan, he will buy more more pesticides and insecticides to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To buy more pesticides and insecticides to sell.

loans.name: Constancio

texts.pt:
Casado maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 são do sexo feminino e 1 do sexo masculino com idades compreendidas entre entre 4 a 9 anos. Ele trabalha no beach bar como servente de mesa e seu maior sonho é terminar sua casa tipo 3 de material convencional na qual já se encontra a residir.
É cliente da instituição a 5 anos, e com o valor do crédito o cliente pretende comprar chapas de zinco, barrotes, e pagar o transporte do mesmo material. 
O seu maior desafio do momento é concluir sua obra. 
Seu maior sonho é viver na sua residência já concluída.
texts.en:
Constancio is married and has three children, two of whom are girls and one is a boy. His children range in age from 4 to 9 years. He works as a waiter at a beach bar, and his biggest dream is finishing his 3-bedroom house. It is built with conventional materials and and he already lives there.
He has been a client of the institution for over five years. With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase zinc plates and beams, and to pay for transportation of these supplies.
His biggest challenge at the moment is getting the construction work done.
His biggest dream is to live in his finished home.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates and beams, and to pay for transportation of these supplies.

loans.name: Alive For Health Group

texts.en:
The “Alive for Health” group will start its eighth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They are made up of four members, and are in the selling of lubricant, yams, tiles, and welding materials. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business people, including John. He says that he joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, he has a business selling lubricants. He reports that he started this business way back. He says he decided to do this business because few people are into the same business and therefore it is more lucrative. 

The loan he will take out now is to buying lubricants at wholesale to sell at retail. He will acquire them from wholesale distributors, and later sell them to drivers and machine operators. This type of work allows him to generate resources to finance his children's education. 

When asked what he likes about ID-Ghana, he says that he likes the training and the healthcare the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy lubricants

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children ages 23, 15, eight and three. Her oldest son is independent. She describes herself as responsible, hard working and credit worthy. 

Twenty years ago, when both Norma and her husband lost their jobs, they decided to start repairing car tires. After a couple of years they began to provide other services such as oil changes. She says that their business is in an excellent location and they charge fair prices.

Norma is requesting a loan to invest in her car shop through the purchase of more oil and tires. She believes that by investing in her enterprise she will be able to make it grow.  Her biggest goal is sending her children to the university.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil for her car repair service

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is aged 30. He sells clothes and has been running this business for the past 2 years.
With this loan he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy land for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron and to pay for laborers to build a room on her property.

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
Antolin, es una persona de 65 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y hortalizas, él se creció con sus abuelos que se dedicaban a los trabajos de hortaliza,  ellos trabajaron y dedicaron toda su vida a realizar esta actividad.

De esta manera, Antolin adquirió conocimiento y experiencia de sus abuelos quienes le inculcaron valores y principios que son los que lo han llevado a continuar desempeñando esta actividad que por años se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos la que le ha servido para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y de esta forma pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y les pudo dar todo lo necesario, ahora ellos son unas personas de bien y de trabajo que de todas las maneras ayudan a su familia

Él tiene una experiencia de casi toda la vida, ya que lo ha realizado desde que era un niño realizando trabajos en la agricultura, y hortalizas se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos quienes se sentían orgullosos de cultivar la tierra día a día, y él era quien los acompañaba todos los días a las parcelas agrícolas llevando una cuma, un azadón y una calabaza con agua siendo estos sus implemento de trabajo.

El decidió dedicarse a este trabajo motivado por sus abuelos, y porque fue una herencia de parte de ellos mismos y que hoy en día quiere dejar a uno de sus nietos a quien ha crecido y ha educado con mucho amor y disciplina y es quien le ayuda en las tareas.

El dinero será utilizado, para comprar  semilla mejorada pata hortalizas y para el montaje de un invernadero, ya que está siendo asistido por personal técnico en agricultura y de esta forma diversificara sus cultivos y mejorara los ingresos 

Las proyecciones que tiene son las de apoyar en los estudios a sus nietos, ya que manifiesta que uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando en la escuela nacional de agricultura. Contribuir a la reforestación de su comunidad, mediante la inversión del crédito y sus ganancias y enseñar a su nieto a trabajar las hortalizas,  ya que él será quien siga sus pasos.
texts.en:
Antolin, age 65, is in the business of farming and growing vegetables. He grew up with his grandparents, who worked their entire lives as farmers and growers of vegetables.

That's how Antolin learned the work. His grandparents also instilled in him values and principles, and these have kept him in the field. Agriculture became over the years his main source of income and his means of providing for his family and getting his children ahead. Now they too are people of good reputation, working to help the family.

He has a lifetime of experience, starting when he was just a little boy doing work in the fields. His grandparents, who taught him, were proud of working the land day by day, and he went with them every day to their plots of land, carrying his tools: a machete, a mattock, and a gourd of water. He entered this line of work to honor his grandparents, and because it was part of his inheritance from them. Today he wants to leave the business to one of his grandchildren whom he has raised and cared for and who helps him in his work.

The loan money will be used to buy improved vegetable seeds and to set up a greenhouse, since he's receiving help from a personal farming technician. This will help him to diversify his crops and improve his income.

His plans are to support his grandchildren' studies, as it turns out one of them is studying at the national school of agriculture. He wants to contribute to reforesting the community. Through his investment in credit and his earnings, he will teach his grandson to work a vegetable garden, and the child will follow in his footsteps.

loans.use: buy improved vegetable seeds and set up a greenhouse

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 38 años de edad. Una persona que lucha por salir adelante a pesar de las circunstancias y tropiezos. Es padre de 4 hijos, a quienes ama muchísimo,  Santos es casado, su compañera de vida es su apoyo en el comercio que él realiza de vender pescado. 

Ellos día a día trabajan arduamente, ya casi tienen 4 años de experiencia en realizar este labor. Cuenta con un equipo de pesca. Ademas de eso vive cerca de la costa, lo cual se le facilita hacer mas grande su negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una motocicleta para salir a vender su producto a la ciudad.

Él quiere emprender otras áreas, quiere que la venta del pescado aumente. Santos sueña a futuro ver su vivienda totalmente remodelada que reúna las condiciones de seguridad para él y la de su familia. De la ganancia que obtiene de su negocio, financiara la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is a 38 year old man- a person that fights to get ahead in spite of the circumstances and setbacks. He is the father of 4 children, who he loves a lot. Santos is married; his wife supports him in his career which is selling fish. 

They work hard day to day, and now have almost 4 years of experience in carrying out this labor. He has fishing equipment, and in addition to this he lives close to the coast, which makes it possible for his business to grow bigger.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a motorcycle so he can go sell his product in the city.

He wants to undertake areas, and wants fish sales to increase. Santos' hopes in the future to see his home totally remodeled to raise the security conditions for him and his family. From the profits that his business has, he will finance his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so he can go sell his product in the city.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 45 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 21 and 18 years.  She sells sorghum and has been in this business for the past 12 years. With the loan, Immaculee would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIEBE un village dans la commune de KIGNA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame ASSITAN assises à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women averaging 39 years of age, with six children. They live mainly in traditional families in Tiebe, a village in the township of Kigna in the district of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their fourth agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans.

They grow peanuts, which is what Mrs. Assitan does, for example. She is the second one seated from left to right in the group photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg [110 lbs] of fertilizers and two jugs of herbicide as well as  pay the costs of labor to work 0.5 ha [1.2 acres] of land.  She plans to earn an average revenue of 74,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle.
This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan with interest and help her husband with everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, herbicides and the costs of labor.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 23 years old. She is married with one child who does not go to school yet. She sells saucepans and has been in this business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more saucepans and basins for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy more land for farming and to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and basins for sale.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. Esta casada y su esposo se desempeña como pescador artesanal. ella no termino la escuela, por lo que decide aprender un oficio siendo este corte y confección y ya cuenta con mas de 10 años realizandolo y lo hace en su casa. Este oficio lo aprendio de su madre, quien tambien se dedicaba a lo mismo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar tela, hilo, broches, etc. Esto le serviara para disponer de insumos para elaborar los pedidos que sus clientes le solicitan. 

Las aspiraciones de María son tener un negocio prospero y rentable en el tiempo y ademas poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos para que tengan una vida digna y tener la preparación que ella no tubo.
texts.en:
31 year old María is the mother of 2 children. She is married and her husband is a fisherman. She did not finish school so she decided to learn a trade, being tailoring and dressmaking and she has been doing this from her home for 10 years. She learned this work from her mother who did the same thing.
The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy fabric, thread, clasps etc. These supplies will help her to meet her customers' orders. 
María's aspirations are to have a prosperous and profitable business in time and also to be able to give her children what they need to live dignified lives and to have the preparation that she did not.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, clasps, etc. , hilo, broches, etc. These supplies will help her to meet her customers' orders.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 35 years old. She is married with five children aged between 16 years and 1 month. Four of the children go to school. Clementine sells sorghum and has been selling for the past 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standard of living for their children and to buy food stuffs.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Scarleth Liseth

texts.es: La tecnología es un conjunto de conocimientos técnicos, científicamente ordenados, que nos permite diseñar y crear bienes y servicios que facilitan la adaptación al medio ambiente y satisfacer tanto las necesidades esenciales como los deseos de la humanidad, es lo que nos dice Scarleth una joven de 23 años que le apasiona muchísimo lo electrónico y que actualmente cursa su carrera de Ing. En Sistema ya que ella anhela crear soluciones que faciliten el trabajo a las demás personas. Solicita un préstamo para la cancelación de los módulos de graduación. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha utilidad por que lograra culminar sus estudios con éxito y de esa forma por entrar al mundo laboral para ejercer su profesión.
texts.en: Technology is a mixture of technical knowledge and scientific order which allows us to design and create goods and services. They facilitate our adaption to the environment and satisfy many essential needs such as human desire. This is what Scarleth a 23 year old youth says. She is impassioned by electronics and is studying Systems Engineering as she hopes to create solutions that make other people's work easier. She is requesting a loan to pay her final units. She thinks that the loan will be very useful as she will be able to finish her studies successfully and so enter the work world to exercise her profession.

loans.use: to pay for her graduating units.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeanette is aged 27. She is married with four children aged between 9 years and 5 months, and two of them go to school. She sells sorghum and has been selling for the past 4 years. With the loan she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standard of living of their children and to buy food stuffs.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Sandra Aracely

texts.es: Sandra de 33 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 15 años de edad y un niño de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la elaboración de tazas y barcos de bambú lo que le ha permitido tener una solidez económica para su hogar. Sandra desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra en mal estado, además desea encementar el piso de su vivienda que como se observa en la fotografía es de tierra. Por lo anterior Sandra solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, cemento, arena y grava para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y encementar el piso de la misma.
texts.en: 33 year old Sandra is a single mother and she lives in her own home along with her 2 children, a 15 year old girl and a 10 year old boy. She is a steadfast woman who, for the past 6 years, has been making cups and boats from bamboo and this has enabled her to have economic stability for her home. Sandra wants to change the roof of her home as it is in a bad state. She also wants to put in a cement floor as the one you can see in the photo is earth. Sandra is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: corrugated metal, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to change the roof of her home and to put in a cement floor.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to change the roof and cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El señor Gumercindo es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una  Aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, al norte de Honduras, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas, su actividad es la venta de madera, desde hace más de 24 años.
Don Gumercindo es aserrador de madera y luego de aserrarla la vende con sus vecinos y conocidos de la comunidad. Además el cultiva café y malanga, necesita el préstamo para poder comprar una moto Sierra ya que la que tenía anteriormente se le arruino y la reparación de la misma es demasiado costosa.
Don Gumercindo espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho y que pueda seguir realizando su actividad comercial la cual genera muy buena parte de los ingresos que recibe en su hogar y esto vendrá a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños de que sus hijas sean personas preparadas y sobre todo luchadores en la vida.
 El espera hacer que su negocio siga creciendo en los próximos años.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Julio- 2014
texts.en:
Gumercindo is a hard-working and responsible person. He lives in a village near Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in northern Honduras. He lives with is spouse and two daughters. He has earned a living selling wood since more than 24 years ago. 
Gumercindo is a wood sawyer, and after cutting it he sells it to his neighbors and acquaintances in the community. He also grows coffee and sweet potatoes. He needs the loan to be able to buy a chainsaw. He had one before, but it broke down and to repair it is too expensive. 
Gumercindo hopes that the loan will help him a lot and that he can continue in his career, which generates most of the income that his household receives. This will improve the quality of life for his family and help him be able to fulfill his dreams that his daughters will become competent people and above all fighters in life. 
He hopes to make his business continue to grow in the coming years. 

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - July - 2014

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw for his business.

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUNA RADIANTE” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, venta de cosmético, venta de llauchas, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de cerveza, salón de peinados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien a quien le ayudo desde niña, con el pasar del tiempo decidió continuar el negocio familia. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LUNA RADIANTE” communal bank is starting their 9th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional office. It is composed of 8 members, lead by a board of directors with María as President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied including a tailor shop, selling cosmetics, selling llauchas (a local food like an empanada), selling quinua juice, selling beer and a beauty salon.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of whom María is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 8 years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a tailor shop and she says that she learned this from her mother who she has helped since she was a child. With the passing of time she decided to continue the family business.

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her working capital (buying fabric wholesale) that she will get from the wholesalers at the markets of the city of El Alto. Later she will make clothing and sell them at her sales place. In this way she can generate resources to support her family as she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she like the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Francina

texts.pt:
Casada maritalmente, mae de 4 filhos ambos do sexo feminino com idades compreendidas entre 16 e19 anos de idade.Esta é uma cliente que também dedica seu dia a dia na venda de artigos de vestuário, cortinas e lencoes de diversas medidas, tem como objectivo melhorar seu estabelecimento para fazer seu negocio em boas condiçoes   
Com o valor financiado pretende comprar fardos de roupas usadas, cortinas e lençoes.
 Seu maior sonho é ver suas filhas com formação superior.
texts.en:
Francina is married and has four children who are girls ranging in age from 16 to 19 years. She's a client who spends her days selling garments, curtains and sheets of various sizes. Her goal is to improve her venue so that she can conduct her business within good conditions.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase bundles of used clothing, curtains and sheets.
Her biggest dream is to see her daughters graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing, curtains and sheets.

loans.name: Lourdes Xiomara

texts.es:
Doña Lourdes es una persona muy trabajadora, vive con su hija y su esposo y tienen más de 4 años de residir en una Aldea de  Cortés al norte de Honduras. 
Doña Lourdes cuenta con una venta de pollo con tajadas, pastelitos, refrescos y agua, tiene más de 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad comercial, cuenta con un punto de venta en el centro de su comunidad y es un lugar muy estratégico ya que ahí está  ubicado el punto de buses, taxis y moto taxis. Lo cual le ayuda a que la afluencia de clientes sea muy buena.
Doña Lourdes está solicitando el préstamo para poder terminar de cancelar la compra de su estufa industrial, mesas y sillas para su negocio y para comprar una cama para su casa. Quiere comprar más mesas y sillas debido  que su clientela va en constante aumento y a veces las mesas con las que cuenta no son suficientes para poder brindarles un buen servicio a sus clientes en la fotografía salen varios de los clientes que visitan su negocio. 
espera que con este préstamo pueda obtener más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y uno de sus sueños es que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo para poder seguir apoyando a sus hijas con la educación para que tenga mejores oportunidades en la vida.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Julio 2014
texts.en:
Lourdes is a very hardworking person. She lives with her daughter and her husband and they have lived in a village in Cortés in the north of Honduras for more than 4 years. 
Lourdes sells pollo con tajadas (a local dish of chicken with plantain), little cakes, sodas, and water and has been doing this for more than 2 years. She has a store in the center of the community and it is very strategically placed as all the buses, taxis, and moto-taxis pick-up there. This helps to ensure that there are many customers. 
Lourdes is requesting a loan to finish paying for her industrial stove, tables and chairs for her business and to buy a bed for her house. She wants to buy more tables and chairs as her customers keep increasing and sometimes the tables that she already has are not sufficient to give her customers good service. Some of the customers who visit her store are in the photo. She hopes that, with this loan, she can increase her profits to improve conditions for her family and one of her dreams is that her business will keep growing so that she can keep supporting her daughter's education so that she will have better opportunities in her life.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - July 2014.

loans.use: to buy  stove, chairs, and tables for her business.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano, which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Tecla is married and has two children. She is a teacher. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and bananas and they also keep livestock. Tecla is excited about beekeeping, as it provide her with honey for both food and medicine.

This is Tecla's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to improve the living standards of her family. Tecla's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Jane is married and has seven children. She is a trader. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for 21 years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, tubers and bananas. Jane is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for food. 

This is Jane's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Jane's hope for the future is to put up rental houses.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Felister is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband have been farming for 24 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, bananas and sugarcane. They also keep livestock. Felister is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Felister's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Her hope for the future is to construct a floor in her house and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

John is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans. millet, cassava and bananas. John is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is John's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. John's hope for the future is to have his children educated and to own oxen to help him in ploughing.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Alice is married and has five children. She is a teacher. She also practices farming with her husband. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas and avocados. Alice is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Alice's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy livestock. Alice's hope for the future is to improve her status and to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Poderosas De Cumaravi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSAS DE CUMARAVI” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido de busos a máquina, venta de pollos a la broster, venta de víveres, tienda de carnicería, venta de condimentos, venta de ropa, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  artesanía en chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años, iniciando como operaria en un taller donde exportaban chompas, aprendiendo la técnica y con un pequeño capital decide independizar su trabajo. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no esta presente una socia, la misma no se encuentra por razones personales.
texts.en:
The loan group Poderosas de Cumaravi will begin their 5th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Amalia is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied and include: a neighborhood store, making sweaters with a machine, selling fried chicken, selling food, a butchers shop, selling condiments, selling clothes, and selling jackets. 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs, including Amalia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 3 years ago on the invitation of a staff member of the institution who visited her home. Currently, she has a business making hand-crafted sweaters. She let us know that she started this business 10 years ago, and she began by working in a workshop that exported sweaters, learned the technique, and decided to become independent when she had a little capital. 
The loan that she is requesting now will be used to increase her capital to buy wool wholesale. She will buy from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and when she has made the sweaters she will sell them from her sales space. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family as she is married and has 5 children. 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the savings that the institution offers.
One of the group members is missing from the photo for personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a Balinese artisan who specializes in hand-crafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was born in a village called Banjar Apuan Singapadu, Sukawati on the island of Bali. I am the eldest of three children from a family of artists, but I was the first in my family to work with silver. I started to learn at the age of fifteen as an apprentice in my village with a good but strict teacher. If I made one piece just a little bit wrong he would be so angry with me, but he also taught me how to work under stress and short time limits. A good foundation, if you ask me! After five years I started on my own to produce original pieces that I sold to local shops. And slowly I was able to save enough money to make my own workshop at home, where I work still until this day. My main inspirations come from nature and the daily life around me. Flowers and animals are my favorite subjects, but sometimes abstract geometrical shapes come into my mind, even though they are inspired strongly by nature originally. Silver is not an easy medium to work with here, because the price changes all the time, but I cannot imagine doing anything else."

"I am pleased to have another opportunity to receive microcredit. It will really help me to be able to buy the silver and gemstones I will need to prepare for the upcoming busy season. I hope the microcredit will help me to increase my sales this year, and I want to thank you for all the support."

Use the link below to view Wayan's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/823

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs

loans.name: Diah

texts.en:
Diah is a Balinese jewelry artist who specializes in pieces crafted in sterling silver. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semi-precious gemstones for her designs.

Diah has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"I was born in Celuk, renowned for its silversmith legacy. When women get married here, we move to the man's house and follow what our husband decides. Luckily, my husband and his parents taught me to design and craft silver jewelry. My designs reflect me and the beauty I find in life. Jewelry to me is about being a woman, and every woman wants to feel beautiful."

"I would like to use this microcredit to be in a good position to expand my sales during the upcoming holiday selling season. Thank you for your support!"

Use the link below to view Diah's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8323

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semi-precious gemstones for her designs

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Faith is married and has three children. She is a teacher. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for nine years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and sunflower and they also keep livestock. Faith is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to manage and it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Faith's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to put up a zero grazing unit for her dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Physcola

texts.en:
Physcola lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Physcola is married and has eleven children. She is an acrobat. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for twenty four years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables and they also keep livestock. Physcola is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Physcola's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Physcola's hope for the future is to have her children educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Alice is married and has three children. She is a treasurer in her local Church. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for nine years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables and they also keep livestock. loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Gladys is married and has five children. She runs her own business. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, vegetables and an orchard. Gladys is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Gladys' first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to build commercial houses. Gladys' hope for the future is to live a better and more fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Prisca is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for eighteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and bananas and they also keep livestock. Prisca is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for both food and medicine.

This is Prisca's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and invest in her farm. Prisca's hope for the future is to build a permanent house and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Rael is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for eighteen years now and they are currently growing maize and vegetables. Rael is excited about beekeeping as it requires low labor input and it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Rael's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family's needs. Rael's hope for the future is to finish building her permanent house.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Gulsina

texts.ru: Гулзина, 24 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей, все дошкольного возраста. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, 6 лет назад Гулзина начала свой бизнес по реализации экологически чистого, домашнего и очень вкусного молока, в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзины, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров с телятами. Большая часть дохода приходится от реализации молока в детские сады, порядка 35 литров в день. Также есть 2,00 ГА собственной и 1,00 ГА арендованной земли, где Гулзина выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения поголовья дойных коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и завершение строительства собственного дома для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Gulsina is 24, married, and raising three young children who have yet to attend grade school.  Six years ago, in search of ways to earn money for her family, she took to raising livestock and growing crops; due to her patience and perseverance, she currently has five cows and some calves on her farm, and earns nearly 15,000 som per month.  She also grows barley on a two-hectare plot of her own and an additional hectare which she rents.  In addition, she started her own business selling tasty, homemade organic milk.  Most of her money comes from milk sales to kindergarten and preschool classes, roughly 35 liters' worth per day.

To increase her milk production, Gulsina has turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners; she is seeking a loan of 100,000 som to buy more dairy cows.  She hopes to use her increased income to further expand her business, as well as finish the construction of her family's house.

loans.use: buy dairy cows to increase her organic milk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn in quintals and lime.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Emily is single with four children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for ten years now and she is currently growing maize and keeping dairy cattle. Emily is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Emily's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Emily's hope for the future is to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.
