texts.en:
Mary lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Mary is married and has six children. She runs her own business and she also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and bananas. Mary is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Mary's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children through college and support the orphans that she lives with. Mary's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, rollers, pins and gates for improvements to her kitchen.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of "the breadbasket of Kenya." Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Hellen is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for thirteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet and vegetables. Hellen is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops. 

This is Hellen's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Hellen's hope for the future is to have her children educated through university.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Yesenia Roxana

texts.es:
Yesenia de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato. Ella está casada pero está en vías de divorcio. Es madre de dos hijos los cuales con sacrifico y empeño ha logrado crecer, el 1ro de ellos estudia séptimo grado y el 2do estudia kínder. Con ella solo viven sus padres y una hermana y sus hijos. 


Yesenia trabaja como impulsadora de arroz, en esta actividad tiene cinco años, aprendió porque antes trabajaba en una tienda igual ofertando sus productos, luego metió papeles al ministerio de trabajo  y le llamaron para que se presentara a trabajar, luego paso por un proceso de inducción para aprender lo que hoy hace. Y al ver que no tenía otra fuente de ingresos para sostener  a su familia decidió quedarse a trabajar con esa empresa. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a unos 18 km de su casa y viaja todos los días en bus.
    

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar  un crédito que tiene con la institución, también tiene otra deuda con una amiga, la cual pretende cancelar  y quedarse solo con una , ella podrá tener un mejor control de sus finanzas ya que estar pensando en un pago y otro es bien complicado según ella. El crédito ayudara a que salga más luego de sus deudas y en seguida poder sacar un nuevo crédito.
El sueño de Yesenia es ayudar a que sus hijos salgan adelante con sus estudios es decir, que se preparan que pueden un día tener un título universitario para que puedan valerse por sí mismos y que tengan las oportunidades que ella no tubo, uno de sus hijos quiere ser Ing. Eléctrico y es un sueño que quiere hacerle realidad.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 30 years old and studied through high school. She is married but is in the process of divorcing. She is the mother of two children, who, with much sacrifice and effort, she has been able to raise. The first is in the seventh grade and the second is in kindergarten. She lives with only her parents, a sister and her children.

Yesenia works as a product salesperson/demonstrator for rice. She has been in this line of work for five years. She learned it because she used to work in a store offering their products. Later she filed with the Labor Ministry and the called her to work. After that, she went through an induction process to learn what she does today. And, seeing that she had no other source of income to support her family, she decided to stay and work with that company. Her workplace is 18km from her house and she travels by bus every day.

The loan that she is requesting is to repay a loan that she has with the institution. She also has another debt with a friend, which she would like to repay and remain with only one debt. She will be able to have better control of her finances since, according to her, having to keep track of one payment and another is quite complicated. The loan will help her get her further out of her debts and then be able to get a new loan.

Yesenia's dream is to help her children move forward with their studies. That is to say, that they prepare themselves in order to one day receive a university degree so they will be able to fend for themselves and have the opportunities that she did not have. One of her children would like to be an Electrical Engineer, and that is a dream that she would like to make a reality.

loans.use: to repay a loan that she has with the institution. She also has another debt with a friend, which she would like to repay and remain with only one debt. She will be able to have better control of her finances since, according to her, having to keep track of one payment and another is quite complicated

loans.name: Xiomara Beatriz

texts.es: Xiomara de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y vive junto a su hija de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace mucho tiempo cuenta con una venta de productos básicos en su vivienda con la cual está saliendo adelante junto a su pequeña hija. Xiomara desea colocar un techo al baño de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía, el área de su baño no cuenta con uno, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para colocarle techo al baño de su vivienda.
texts.en: Xiomara, age 21, is a single mother and lives with her 1-year-old daughter. She is a tenacious woman who has sold basic staples in her home for a long time now. This is allowing her to get ahead and care for her little girl. Xiomara wants to put a roof over her home's bathroom because, as can be seen in the photo, the bathroom does not have a roof. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase galvanized laminate, perlines and pins to roof her bathroom.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, perlines, and pins to roof her home's bathroom.

loans.name: Marlene Ester

texts.es: Marlene de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su nieta de 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 8 años se gana la vida gracias a la venta de pupusas que posee en su vivienda, actividad que realiza todos los fines de semana. Marlene desea construir un muro perimetral enfrente de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, grava, ladrillos, hierro y arena, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir el muro perimetral frente a su vivienda.
texts.en: Marlene, age 48, lives in her own home with her 13-year-old granddaughter. She is a tenacious woman who has been making a living for 8 years selling pupusas from her home. She does this every weekend. Marlene wants to build a wall in front of her home, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, gravel, bricks, iron and sand. She also has to pay the labourers to build the wall in front of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, iron and sand, and to pay the labourers to build a wall in front of her home.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella es muy responsable y trabajadora, desde hace varios años posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela, con lo que vende logra solventar algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, María solicita un crédito para la compra de productos para su tienda como: jabón, detergente, gaseosa, jugos, frijoles, queso, arroz, etc. y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 51, lives in her own house with her children.  She is very responsible and hardworking.  

For a number of years she has had a store in her home.  She has a large clientele that she sells to, managing to pay for some of the household needs.  

María is asking for a loan to buy products for her store such as soap, detergent, soda, juice, beans, cheese, rice, etc.  In this way she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, soda, juice, beans, cheese, rice, etc.

loans.name: Iris Jossemy

texts.es:
Doña Iris es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a su hijo y su esposo. Su actividad comercial es la venta de carne de res.
Doña Iris sus clientes son las pulperías y abarroterías de su comunidad así como también a sus vecinos, necesita el préstamo para poder comprar más carnes de res y abastecer a su clientela.
Doña Iris espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a este podrá mejorar los ingresos de su hogar y contara con lo necesario para poder atender a su clientela, espera hacer que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia para que cumplan sus metas y sueños en la vida. 


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - Julio - 2014
texts.en:
Iris is a hard-working and responsible person who lives in a community in the North of Honduras together with her son and her husband. Her business is selling beef. Iris's customers are small stores and grocery stores in her community as well as her neighbors. She needs the loan to buy more beef to supply her clients. Iris hopes that the loan will help her continue to grow. In this manner she can support her family so that they can accomplish their goals and dreams in life.





Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - Julio - 2014

loans.use: to buy beef for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer y trabajadora que se desempeña elaborando pan francés en su vivienda, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, su amplia experiencia le ha permitido que cada día su clientela crezca más. Rosa desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 24, lives in her own house together with her partner and her two children, ages 6 and 12.  She is a hardworking woman who works selling French bread from her home.  She has been doing this for ten years.  Her ample experience has allowed her to expand her clientele more and more each day.  

Rosa wants to change the roof on her home.  She is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheet metal, purlins, and pins in order to change her house’s roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, purlins, and pins to change the roof on her home.

loans.name: Manos De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANOS DE ORO” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de empanadas, venta de jugos, venta de ropas, tienda de ferretería, costura de overoles, venta de medias, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comerciante de juguetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo heredo de su madre hace trece años. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las socias no esta presente por razones de salud se quedo en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The “MANOS DE ORO” communal bank is starting their 2nd cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Regional office. It is composed of eight members with Verónica as President. The businesses of the communal bank's members are varied amongst them: the sale of empanadas, selling juice, clothing sales, a hardware store, sewing overalls, selling stockings and the sale of meals.

The loan will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs including Verónica. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She has a business selling toys. She says that she inherited the business from her mother three years ago.

The loan that she is taking is to increase her capital (buying toys wholesale) that she will acquire in the traditional markets of the city of El Alto. Later she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is in a common-law relationship and has three children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the training and the health services offered by the institution. One of the members is missing from the photo as for health reasons she was at the doctors.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: Theodomile

texts.en: Theodomile is 30 years old. He has been selling various items in his boutique such as sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for three years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil. The profit from his business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en: Aloys is 49 years old. He is married with 10 children aged between 4 and 27; all of them go to school. He has been selling clothes such as trousers, skirts and t-shirts for 20 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more trousers and skirts for sale. The profit from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere, aged 36 years old, is married with three children, aged between 2 and 14. Two of them go to school. She has been selling stones for building for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more stones to sell. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more stones to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computer accessories for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma, aged 34 years old, is married with two children, aged between 10 and 13. Both of them go to school. She has been selling stones for building material for 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more stones for building. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy more stones for building to sell.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janvier, 32 years old, is married with one child, aged one year old. who does not yet go to school. She has been selling shoes for two years. With the loan she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 46 years old and married. She has six children between the ages of 21 and 10. All of them go to school. She works in a shop, and she has been working for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, salt, sugar, and biscuits for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy soap, salt, sugar, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, aged 54 years old, is married with seven children, aged between 17 and 35. All of them go to school. She has been selling stones for building materials for 30 years. With the loan she would like to be a stone supplier. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and reinvest more.

loans.use: To be a stone supplier.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma, aged 36 years old, is married with two children aged between 17 and 20. Both of them go to school. She has been selling shoes for 12 years. With the loan she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en:
Annociathe is 28 years old. She is married with three children aged between 8 and 3   years. One of them goes to school. 

She sells Irish potatoes, and she has been running a business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and buy foodstuffs and domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two calves and a part for a tool that will help him do better work.

loans.name: Corazones Unidos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES UNIDOS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jovanna es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de jugos de fruta, salón de peinados, venta de zapatillas deportivas, venta de chinelas, librería, servicio de transporte, editorial.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jovanna es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra a Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que conformaba un Banca Comunal en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de chinelas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia al observar la amplia comercialización del producto. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chinelas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de santa Cruz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de las Ciudades de Cochabamba y Santa Cruz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidos Communal Bank will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Regional Office.  It is composed of eight members and it is directed by a board of directors, of which Señora Jovanna is secretary. The members of the communal bank run various businesses. They include: cosmetics sales, fruit juice sales, a hair salon, athletic shoe sales, sandal sales, a book store, a transportation service, and publishing. 

The loan that they will receive will benefit the small businesswomen of whom Señora Jovanna is a member. She says that this is the first time that she is joining Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a neighbor who is part of a communal bank in the institution. 

Currently, she has a business selling sandals, and she reveals that she started this business on her own initiative, upon observing how widely the products were sold. The loan that she will receive is for increasing capital, purchasing wholesale sandals from the wholesalers from the city of Santa Cruz. She will sell them later at the fairs in the cities of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz.  This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family, as she is single, and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sandals.

loans.name: Magdalena Trinidad

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Magdalena, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella sufre de una enfermedad de nacimiento por lo cual siempre anda acompañada de su mamá. 
Doña Magdalena es una joven que a pesar de sus limitaciones por su enfermedad le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos naturales de la marca Garden,  ella con la ayuda de su mamá salen a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos,  tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran sus prendas y mucho más los productos naturales ya que son tratamientos continuos y porque ella se ha ganado el aprecio de todos sus clientes que siempre le ayudan comprando sus productos,  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 7 años dedicada a esta actividad con lo cual se gana algo por su bien. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  productos naturales. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños mejorar cada día mas.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city re-known for it's great diversity of traditional products like the nationally and internationally famous Panama Hat, the "Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos" communal bank meets every fortnight.

Magdalena lives here. She is 28 years old, single and lives in her parent's house. She has a ailment that she has had from birth so she always is in company of her mother. In spite of the limitations from her infirmity Magdalena is a youth who likes to work in order to get ahead.

She works selling all types of clothing and natural products from the Garden Brand. With the help of her mother she goes out through her whole area offering her products. She has lots of clients who always buy her clothing and even more so the natural products. They are continuous treatments and because she has won the appreciation of her customers they always support her buying her products. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been involved in this business for more than seven years and is able to generate some money for herself.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and natural products. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and likes it as it helps her to get ahead. Her dreams get better every day.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and natural products.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 29 years old. She is married with four children aged between 11 and 7 years, all of whom go to school. She sells Irish potatoes and has been running a business for the past 18 years old. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Bolivia Andina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVIA ANDINA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de leche, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de golosinas, venta de chompas, venta de jugo de quinua.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que es tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia por iniciativa propia, hace cuatro años, al observar que estos productos son ampliamente requeridos en su comunidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra un varon vestido con un deportivo azul con detalles rojos él es esposo de una a de las nuevas clientes que quiso salir en la imagen.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bolivia Andina" will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Primitiva is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are selling vegetables, neighborhood store, selling milk, selling food, weaving blankets, selling candies, selling sweaters, and selling quinoa juice.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Primitiva is one. She indicates that this is the third time she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a recruiter from the institution who came to visit her in her home. She now has a business of selling vegetables. She lets it be known that she began this business on her own initiative four years ago, on observing that these products are extensively needed in her community.

The loan that she will take out now is for food in the time of drought (to buy vegetables wholesale). She will acquire the vegetables from the vendors in the city of El Alto and then she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to help her family, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health service that the institution offers.

In the photograph, there is a man wearing a blue sports outfit with red trim. He is the husband of one of the new clients who wanted to be in the picture.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many kinds of makeup, cosmetics, and accessories for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Nancy is married and has five children. Both she and her husband run a small business. They practice farming as well. They have been farming for four years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, green grams and sunflower. Nancy is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Nancy’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Nancy’s hope for the future is to expand her business and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Pauline is married and has twelve children. She is a Church Elder. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for forty years now and are currently growing maize, vegetables, and bananas. They also keep livestock. Pauline is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Pauline's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her grandchildren. Pauline's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia - one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas - with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

David is married and has eight children. He is a Voluntary Community Health Worker. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for forty-four years now and are currently growing maize and beans. They also keep livestock. David is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food.

This is David's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to improve his livelihood. David's hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Kricia Cristina

texts.es: Kricia de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y su padre, ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, para luego salir a comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Kricia solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, semillas, etc. y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Kricia, who is 30 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her children and her father. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She has raised corn for a number of years. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the granaries that are shown in the photograph in order to go out to sell it later in the various markets near her home. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay for the necessities that arise in her household. Kricia is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, seeds, etc., and thus be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Daniel is married and has seven children. He is a leader in his local tea buying center. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for twenty years now and are currently growing maize and tea. They also keep livestock. Daniel is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops and thus increase his production.

This is Daniel's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Daniel's hope for the future is to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jimmy Wilmer

texts.es: Jimmy es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, gracias al apoyo de sus padres está estudiando la carrera profesional de Ciencias de la Comunicación, es muy aplicado por lo cual siempre obtiene los primeros lugares. Asimismo, para ayudar con algunos gastos trabaja como DJ en una Discoteca cerca de la zona donde vive. Ha sabido ganarse el respeto y admiración de las personas porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace. Jimmy quiere comprar un televisor para su casa, para que de esta manera pueda disfrutar de sus momentos libres con su familia y se relaje un poco y mejore su calidad de vida, con esto él seguirá luchando para poder culminar su carrera y convertirse en un profesional exitoso.
texts.en: Jimmy is a young entrepreneur. He is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Ica with his family. He is a person with a great will to get ahead. Thanks to the support of his parents, he is studying in the professional course in Communication Sciences. He is very diligent, and so he always obtains the top places. In addition, to help with some expenses, he works as a DJ in a discotheque near the zone where he lives. He has known how to win people's respect and admiration because he always tries hard in everything that he does. Jimmy wants to buy a television for his home, so that in this way he can enjoy his free moments with his family and relax a little and improve his quality of life. With this he will continue working to be able to finish his program and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Gulmairam

texts.ru: Гульмайрам 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Гульмайрам с 2002 года занимается животноводством, полеводством и пчеловодством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гульмайрам на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров, 1 лошадь, 6 овец, 6 коз, также 0,96 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Дополнительно есть 25 ящиков пчелосемей и 20 бочек меда. Семья Гульмайрам имеет мини мельницу и грузовую автомашину, оказывая услуги односельчанам.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмайрам обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulmairam is 42 years old, married, with three children. As a main source of income for her family, Gulmairam has been raising livestock, growing farm produce and keeping bees since 2002. She launched her farm business with a starting capital of 25,000 KGS. At present Gulmairam's farm includes six cows, one horse, six sheep, and six goats; she also has 0.96 ha [2.5 acres] of own land, where she grows corn and clover. In addition, she has 25 beehives and 20 barrels of honey. Gulmairam's family owns a grinding machine and a truck, used to provide services to local village inhabitants. In order to develop her business further, Gulmairam has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy  steers. She plans to use the resulting revenue for a further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase steers in order to invest in her livestock business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Margaret is a widow with two children. She also takes care of eight orphans. She runs a small business of bulking and reselling grains and she is a farmer as well. She has been farming for ten years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, sorghum, sweet potatoes, and cassava. Margaret is excited about beekeeping as it does not require much input and it will provide her with honey for food and medicine.

This is Margaret's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to expand her business. Margaret's hope for the future is to expand her beekeeping project so as to produce more honey and earn more income from it.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lewnida

texts.en:
Lewnida lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya close both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Lewnida is a widow with nine children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for thirty years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, sweet potatoes, cassava, and sunflower. Lewnida is excited about beekeeping as she has been longing to keep bees and it will earn her some income from the sale of honey. 

This is Lewnida’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a small business. Lewnida’s hope for the future is to have an economic difference in her life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Yanaturo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo está  conformado por 11 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les han permitido mejorar la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Las socias son personas muy amables, cordiales. 
Viven por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 22, 20, 19, 7 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia enfermería, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña María desde hace varios años se dedica a la limpieza de casas,  los fines de semana y cuando tiene tiempo se dedica a la venta de ropa  y le va bien en el negocio. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa. Su meta es de tener un negocio de venta de comida que es lo que le gusta.
texts.en:
The community bank, Yanaturo, consists of 11 women who work in different activities that have enabled them to improve the economy of their homes and raise their families. The members are very friendly, cordial people.

They live in the Yanaturo sector in the city of Cuenca, which is the third most economically important of the country, has a varied gastronomy and people who keep their culture and traditions.

One member of this group is Mary.  She is 40 years old, married and has 5 children aged of 22, 20, 19, 7 and 9 years old.  Her first child is studying nursing, her second daughter is married and lives independently, her third child is in college and the last two children are in a school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee. They don't have their own home so they rent a place.

For the past several years, María has worked at cleaning houses.  On weekends and when she has time, she also sells clothes and is doing well in business. The money from the loan will go to buying more clothes. Her goal is to have a business selling food because that is what she likes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda

She has  a store in which she sells men´s clothes and uniforms.  Yolanda is asking for a loan to buy more product variety for her store. She says that she is preparing for the high sales season. She is hard working and likes to save and invest. Her biggest accomplishment is maintaining her business and being able to save and invest.

loans.use: To buy men´s clothes and uniforms for sale

loans.name: Jimema

texts.en: Jimema is single and lives with her parents in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She works as a state broker and also helps her parents in operating their own farm for a living. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs for farm fertilization and weeding maintenance. She is willing to help her parents and the entire family as she wants everyone in the family to improve. In the future, she wants to buy farmland of her own for a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for farm fertilization and weeding maintenance

loans.name: Angeli Love

texts.en: Angeli Love has one child and is separated from her husband. She has her own buy and sell business and a motorcycle transport rental business. The daily rent paid for her motorcycle has helped her to sustained her living. She took out a new loan to buy spare parts and to cover maintenance costs. Her future dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar junto a su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía, y continuar con sus cultivos y así tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower is 25 years old, and lives with his life partner.  He is dedicated to the cultivation of corn and beans, and sells his products in different markets that are close to his home.

With the proceeds he receives from his sales, he addresses some of the needs that he has in his home.  The borrower requests a loan for the purchase of herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, etc. as shown in the photograph.

In this way, he can continue growing his crops and thus have, along with his family, better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de 37 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus hijos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, ella posee una tienda y un molino, con lo que gana de sus ventas logara solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Elizabeth solicita un crédito para la compra  de granos básicos, azúcar, sopas, golosinas, refrescos, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas  y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children.  She is a hardworking and responsible person.

She has a store and a mill and earns enough from the sales to meet the needs of the household.

Elizabeth requests a loan for the purchase of basic grains, sugar, soups, snacks, soft drinks, etc. all wholesale.  In this manner, she can continue with her sales and thus can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale basic grains, sugar, soups, snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Katherin Del Carmen

texts.es: Katherin es una mujer laboriosa, quien tiene la edad de 22 anos y soltera, impulso hace tres años su negocio propio como es la comercialización de frutas y verduras en la municipalidad, es primer ciclo que solicita los financiamientos en esta institución e invertirá en la compra de nancite, mamón, ayote, yuca y quequisque al por mayor.
texts.en: Katherin is an industrious woman who is 22 years old and single.  Three years ago, she started her own business of selling fruits and vegetables in her town.  This is the first loan that she is requesting from ADIM.  She will invest in the purchase of nance fruit, Spanish limes, pumpkins, cassava, and “quequisque” (a tuber similar to taro root) in bulk.

loans.use: to buy nance fruit, Spanish limes, pumpkins, cassava, and “quequisque”.

loans.name: Mervyn

texts.en: Mervyn is married with two children and is operating a piggery to make a living. For seven years, the business has been sustained and is doing well. He plans for piggery improvements and for this, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy more piglets and feeds. Improving his business becomes easier now with his access to GDMPC. In the future, Mervyn wants to improve the general living standards of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor in order to maintain her cassava crops.

loans.name: Pi Tauk Kone

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 24 village customers, including six CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. The villagers have difficulty accessing clean water and reliable roads. There is also a shortage of labor because many young people are migrating to other cities for job opportunities. Every dry season, nearly 30 young people migrate to other cities.

The new loan will help village clients purchase livestock, which is their secondary source of income after farming groundnuts and sesame. They aspire to raise goats, sheeps, and pigs and use the manure as natural fertilizer to improve their farms' soil conditions. One small animal costs about $50 and can be resold for a profit. With this extra income from livestock, villagers can support their families' health, education, and living expenses. Also, extra money is contributed to village development projects, such as repairing the water basin and rebuilding the village roads.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Pi Tauk Kone Village CBO: U Win, U Hlaing, U Myo, U Khine, Daw May, and Daw Mya. Included in the photo (third from the right) is U Khine, who is 33 years old and married. His son is in University, and U Khine supports his education. He purchased topsoil and fertilizer with his past loan and wants to purchase three or four goats with this new loan.

loans.use: to help 24 villagers raise livestock to resell for a profit and produce natural fertilizer

loans.name: Edita Guillermina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad. El marido trabaja en el campo. 
Doña Edita con la ayuda de su marido desde hace varios años construyo un pequeño galpón en la cual empezó su negocio de cría de pollos,  actualmente tiene cerca de 200 pollos los mismos que espera que pronto estén listos para la venta,  los tiene por tres meses luego y los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar los pollos. Lleva tres años realizando esta actividad con la cual salen adelante ya que su marido gana muy poco en sus faenas en el campo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products, such as palm fiber hats ["Panama" hats] that are well-known in and outside of the country, the members of the "Grupo de Crédito Nueva Esperanza de los Bajos" meet every 15 days. This is where Edita lives. She is 57 years old and she is in a common-law marriage from which she has five grown children. Her husband works in the fields. 

Several years ago, Edita, with her husband's help, built a small chicken house, where she started her chicken raising business. She currently has 200 chickens, which she hopes will soon be ready for sale. She has them for three months and then turns them over to buyers who come to her to buy the chickens. She has been doing this business for three years, which helps them get ahead, since her husband earns very little thruoug his work in the fields. 

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicines for the chickens. She has been in the loan group since it began, and she likes it because they always give her the loans so she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for chickens.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 21-year-old student at a university. She lives with her parents in Pursat Province of Cambodia. Because of the lack of financial support, Sina would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she wants to find a good job with a reasonable salary so that she will be able to support her family. She also wants to pursue a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Hpa Lan Pin Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. There are now three water basins which are still in need of repair that supply water for the entire village. Especially in the hot summer, the whole village suffers from a lack of reliable water supply.  Additionally, the village does not have a health clinic, so villagers need to travel to neighboring towns for medical attention.

The new loan will enable this community to purchase fertilizer, compost, and topsoil to improve soil conditions and increase the production and quality of crops. Farmers mainly cultivate sesame, groundnuts, millet and pigeon pea. With extra income from crop sales, they usually buy goats to raise at home. Some people want to increase their incomes by opening a small grocery store in the village, working on construction sites, or tapping toddy-palm trees for sugar.  Additionally, the CBO committee members are planning to purchase a small truck for the village's common use in order to solve transportation problems in getting harvested crops to markets.

Pictured above are the committee members from the CBO village: U Khin, Daw Win, U Win, U Myo, and U Aung. Included in the photo (third from the right) is U Win, who is 38 years old and married.  His main income is farming, but he also works as a broker in off seasons. He has five family members, and three of them are still students. Two students are attending middle school in the village.  He used his past loan for farming inputs and will use his next loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: to help 54 villagers buy fertilizer, compost, and topsoil to improve soil conditions

loans.name: Wuyetegue 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  WUYETEGUE 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKO un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SILAMENI débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  WUYETEGUE 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 7 members of the 'Wuyetegue 2' Group are all married men who are, on average, 46 years old and have 8 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of N'Goloko, Dogoni commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The men work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second production loan to grow maize.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Silameni (standing second from the right in the photo) grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy eight 50kg sacks of fertilizer, ten drums of differing qualities of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work one hectare of land.  After the harvest, he sells the maize in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Silameni expects to make an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Wuyetegue 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe  WUYETEGUE 3 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKO un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SALIF débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  WUYETEGUE 3. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the 'Wuyetegue 3' Group are all married men who are, on average, 45 years old and have 7 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of N'Goloko, Dogoni commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The men work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second production loan to grow maize.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Salif (standing second from the right in the photo) grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy eight 50kg sacks of fertilizer, ten drums of differing qualities of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work one hectare of land.  After the harvest, he sells the maize in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Salif expects to make an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
All the members of the Ratna Sari Group are pleased with the results of their pig business. They have made their payments on time. The Ratna Sari Group is grateful to all lenders, Kiva, and MUK for the support they have had during their loan period. Ni Putu, as the head, feels happy for the group she leads. Now every member of the Ratna Sari Group has savings and will use it for business capital. Ni Putu just gave birth to her second child and, with support from her husband, she has decided to propose a new loan to increase her business. She sold her pigs to make her payment and also to celebrate her new baby.
The Ratna Sari Group has agreed to a new loan to increase the number of pigs, renovate the cages, and buy superior quality feed.
Ni Putu will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior quality piglets and feed. As the head of the group, Ni Putu hopes her group will stay cohesive and always share the latest information about the pig business among members.
One member could not attend this meeting because she was sent by the village officer for a training in the city.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena has switched from selling snacks to selling whole coconuts and copra. Her business is doing well and sufficiently provides for her family. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason why she has borrowed another loan from PMPC is to buy more whole coconuts for resale. In the future, Nena hopes to buy a hauling truck for delivery.

loans.use: to buy more whole coconuts for resale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, and candies to sell in her general store.

Cristina has been in this business for 11 years. Cristina earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, and candies to sell

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à TIBINA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur ADAMA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  KOTOGNOGONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  10 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  230 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the 'Kotognogontala 1' Group are all married men who are, on average, 48 years old and have 8 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Tibina, Lobougoula commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The men work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their fifth production loan to grow maize.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Adama (standing on the left in the photo) grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy ten 50kg sacks of fertilizer, fifteen drums of differing qualities of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work one and a half hectares of land.  After the harvest, he sells the maize in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Adama expects to make an average profit of 230,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: DAOUDA est un jeune homme qui est âgé de 31 ans. Il habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le guichet. Il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans la commercialisation des pièces détachées. Il a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Il demande ce prêt pour acheter des pièces détachées venant d’Europe pour les revendre à ses clients. Il gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir, DAOUDA  voudrait avoir une place plus confortable et gagner le monopole du marché en pièces détachées. Il voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et acheter des voitures d’occasion pour ensuite les revendre.
texts.en:
Daouda is a young man who is 31 years old.  He lives in the district where the field partner is based.  Daouda is married and has children.  He has more than five years' experience in selling spare parts.

Daouda has requested this loan in order to buy spare parts from Europe, for resale to his customers.  He is responsible for all the day-to-day expenses of his family, and the school fees for his children.  He begins work at eight in the morning and finishes at six in the evening.

In the future, Daouda would like to develop a monopoly on the spare parts market and become more comfortable.  He would also like to increase his earnings and buy second-hand cars for resale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette has a live-in partner with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernadette is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Bernadette has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Bernadette requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to pay internet and electric bills.

Bernadette has been in this business for three years. In the future, Bernadette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay internet and electric bills.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Fermina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Fermina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 38 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Esperanza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Esperanza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Esperanza would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à TIBINA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur YACOUBA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  KOTOGNOGONTALA 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  10 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  230 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the 'Kotognogontala 2' Group are all married men who are, on average, 47 years old and have 8 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Tibina, Lobougoula commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The men work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their fifth production loan to grow maize.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Yacouba (standing on the right in the photo) grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy ten 50kg sacks of fertilizer, fifteen drums of differing qualities of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work one and a half hectares of land.  After the harvest, he sells the maize in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Yacouba expects to make an average profit of 230,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Senidjeni 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SENIDJENI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MANDELA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame MARIAM débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme    SENIDJENI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the 'Senidjeni 1' Group are all married women who are, on average, 46 years old and have 5 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the Mandela commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second loan.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Mariam (standing on the left in the photo) grows rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy three 50kg sacks of fertilizer, three drums of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work three-quarters of a hectare of land.  After the harvest, she sells the rice in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Mariam expects to make an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable her to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband provide for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: ASTOU est une femme qui est âgée de 37ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle fait le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine comme les tasses, cuillères, et vend en même temps du savon en poudre (OMO). Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle demande ce crédit de ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Grace à l’aide de l’institution, elle voudrait  augmenter ses revenus, épargner de l’argent et construire sa maison. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou is a 37-year-old woman who is married with children.  She has more than three years' experience in selling kitchen utensils, such as cups and spoons.  She also sells Omo soap powder.

Astou has requested this loan in order to increase her stocks of product and diversify the range of goods that she offers.  She helps her husband to provide for their day-to-day expenses, and to pay for the school fees of their children.  She begins work at nine in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.

Benefitting from the help of the field partner, Astou would like to increase her earnings, save more money and be able to build a house.  In this way, she would improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Senidjeni 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe SENIDJENI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MANDELA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SALIMATA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SENIDJENI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the 'Senidjeni 2' Group are all married women who are, on average, 47 years old and have 7 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Mandela commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second production loan.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Salimata (standing second from the left in the photo) grows rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of fertilizer, two drums of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  After the harvest, she sells the rice in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Salimata expects to make an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable her to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the daily expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative early this year. She sought their financial help and she tried her luck on starting a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels the tied has turned in her favor, for having trusted her with the money she used as capital, PMPC has now lent her another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. 

Gaudiosa is looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Nga Lone Pho Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. There are five main income-generating businesses in the village, including farming, livestock raising, construction work, handmade crafts, and seasonal work in urban centers. Farmers usually grow groundnuts, sesame, pigeon pea and millet.

This new loan will enable this community to raise livestock such as goats, pigs and sheep. Most prefer to raise pigs, as one piglet costs about $45 to purchase and can be resold at $120 for a $75 profit after 7 months of raising it. This additional income from livestock is very helpful to support family expenses and other necessary contributions for village development. Given the unreliability of electricity and clean water, villagers aspire to purchase a solar light and to build a well to improve their access to these necessities.

Pictured above are the committee members from Ngar Lone Pho village CBO: U Win, U Htay, U Aung, U Min, U Zaw and U Paw. Included in the photo is U Aung (the person sitting) who is a 34-year-old farmer and the father of a primary student who is attending school in the village. He used his previous loan to buy quality seeds and fertilizer. With his new loan, he wants to purchase two piglets to raise at his home.

loans.use: to help 33 villagers to raise livestock such as pigs, goats and sheep

loans.name: Jenny Yaranara

texts.es: Jenny de 36 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar, ella posee una sala de belleza en su lugar de residencia es un lugar muy transitado por esa razón posee mucha clientela, ella es una persona responsable y trabajadora,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Jenny solicita un crédito para la compra de tintes, mechas para el cabello, shampoo, etc. y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jenny is 36 years old and lives with her family. She owns a beauty salon in her home. It is an area that is very busy, for that reason she has many clients. She is a very responsible and hardworking person. With her earnings from sales she can afford to pay for what she needs and the costs that she has at home. Jenny is requesting a loan to buy dyes, hair highlights, shampoo, etc and through this she will be able to give her family a better quality of life with any limitations.

loans.use: to buy dyes, hair highlights, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rafael De Jesus

texts.es: Rafael de 41 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el posee un servicio de molino ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el es una excelente persona, muy responsable y trabajador, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Rafael solicita un crédito para invertir en su molino y comprar cuchillas, discos, etc. y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rafael is 41 years old and lives with his family in their own home. He is an excellent person, and is very responsible and hardworking. With what he earns from sales, he manages to meet the needs and expenses of his household.
