He has a mill service located at his residence. Rafael is asking for the loan to invest in his mill and buy blades, discs, etc. This will allow him to give his family a better quality of life without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos menores de edad, con la mama y la hermana, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, María solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería  para el negocio como: lociones, cremas, perfumes, shampoo, etc. para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her two young children, her mother, and her sister. She makes a living selling personal use products. She sells by going on rounds around the different suburbs found close to her home. 

With what she earns from her sales, she manages to pay the necessities of her household. Maria is asking for the loan in order to buy more merchandise for her business, such as lotions, creams, perfumes, shampoo, etc. in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, perfumes, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Incry Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Incry es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en un barrio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, al norte de Honduras, desde hace más de 5 años.

Doña Incry tiene algunas actividades comerciales como ser la venta de tortillas, también la venta de hielo, frescos, etc. también vende ropa usada la cual sale a vender los fines de semana a las aldeas aledañas.

Doña Incry está solicitando el préstamo para poder invertir en sus negocios en la compra de  maíz, leña, blusas, faldas, pantalones, etc. para sus negocios, espera que con este préstamo su negocio pueda abastecer a muchas más personas de su comunidad y de esta manera le generara más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Doña Incry sueña con que sus negocios puedan seguir creciendo y poder seguir generándole mejores ganancias y también seguir trabajando con este tipo de créditos para en un futuro uno de sus sueños es darles un mejor futuro a su familia.





Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Julio 2014
texts.en:
Incry is a hardworking and responsible person. She has lived with her husband and her two children in a neighbourhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in the north of Honduras, for more than five years.

Incry has a few business activities including the sale of tortillas, as well as the sale of ice, soft drinks, etc. She also sells second-hand clothing, which she goes out to sell on the weekends to neighbouring villages.

Incry is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her business in the purchase of corn, firewood, blouses, skirts, pants, etc. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to supply many more people in her community and in this way generate more income to improve the living conditions of her family.

Incry dreams that her businesses will continue to develop and hopes to be able to continue improving her earnings and also to continue to work with this type of loan as one of her dreams is to be able to provide a better future for her family.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, blouses, skirts, pants, etc for her businesses

loans.name: Myin Su Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Myothit township, this community currently has 15 village customers, including five CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. The village is covered with sand soil, and, thus, it is difficult to grow high quality crops and get enough water. The village always celebrates Buddhist cultural ceremonies, such as offering provisions to monks.

The new loan will enable borrowers to hire laborers to help with harvesting and to purchase high quality seeds for next season. Capital for harvesting expenses is essentially needed because the farmers have to harvest the crops very soon. For next season, additional capital is needed to purchase quality seeds for crops such as groundnuts, pigeon pea, and green gum. One grain of those seeds costs, on average, $50. They also have to cultivate millet to feed their cows. In addition, the village is now raising funds to build a well at the monastery, where every household can get enough water for domestic use. Currently, the village has only one old well to supply water. 

Pictured above are the committee members from Myin Su Village CBO: U Win, U Thein, U Than, U Kyaw and U Than. Included in the photo (second from the left) is U Win, who is 50 years old and has nine family members. His new loan will be used for purchasing sesame seeds and high quality fertilizers for his farm.  As he is raising livestock such as cows and bulls, these animals' manures are used as a supplement to expensive chemical fertilizers to improve soil conditions on his farm.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help with harvesting and to purchase high quality seeds

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda joined PMPC and availed the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. Erlinda was able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Tha Pyay Yin Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 27 village customers, including six CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. There are many difficulties in this community such as insufficient, water supply, weak road networks, and unreliable electricity supply.  Most villagers in this community are Buddhist, so they invest in traditional cultural ceremonies such as providing provisions to monks.

The new loan will enable those borrowers to purchase livestock such as pigs and goats. One piglet is about $50 and can be resold at $100 for a $50 profit after seven months of care.  To supplement their income from farming and livestock, villagers will tap the sugar from toddy palm trees, make clothes, set up small trading businesses, and work as officials in the local government.  The extra income will be used to repair the only primary school in the village, set up a machine by the well to generate electricity, and open a cold drinks kiosk.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Thay Pyay Yin village CBO: U Tin, U Aung, Daw Than, Daw Ngal, U Thaung, and U Win. Included in the photo is U Win (second from the left), who is a 37-year-old single farmer. His main businesses are raising livestock and farming.  He purchased sesame and groundnut seeds with his previous loan. This season, he will buy two piglets and additional seeds.

loans.use: to help 29 villagers to purchase goats and pigs

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Bebiana successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Bebiana's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Sivhon's Group

texts.en: Sivhon, 44 years old, is a mother of five children and resides in Battambang province. Four of her children are in school. She struggles for a living via rice farming as the main source of her family's income and works as a paid worker to earn extra income. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. As a leader of a group of three members, Sivhon will use this money to buy a toilet to upgrade her living. She hopes this loan can help her family have good health.

loans.use: To buy a toilet

loans.name: Senidjeni 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe SENIDJENI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MANDELA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame FATOUMATA C débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SENIDJENI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the 'Senidjeni 3' Group are all married women who are, on average, 42 years old and have 6 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Mandela commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second production loan.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Fatoumata (standing on the right in the photo) grows rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of fertilizer, two drums of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  After the harvest, she sells the rice in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Fatoumata expects to make an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable her to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the daily expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is single and has a business while he works as a teacher. He also has a part-time job as a tutor in a private school. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used to finance the cost of his review. He is hopeful of having a better career in the future and being able to improve the general living situation of his family. Recently, he took a new loan for financial support for his brother to travel abroad.

loans.use: to pay for his brother to travel abroad

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Monsieur KALIFA est né vers 1972 à LOBOUGOULA, marié, père de 10 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec ses épouses dans une famille traditionnelle à LOBOUGOULA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son troisième prêt de production de maïs avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts précédant ont été correctement remboursés.  
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 10 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectares.
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau de village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 230 000 francs CFA par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kalifa was born around 1972 in Lobougoula.  He is married, father to ten children and lives with them and his wives in a traditional family in the commune of Lobougoula, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

He works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve his agricultural business during the winter season.  This will be his third production loan to grow maize.  The previous loans were both fully and correctly repaid.

Kalifa grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy ten 50kg sacks of fertilizer, fifteen drums of differing qualities of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work one and a half hectares of land.  After the harvest, he sells the maize in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Kalifa expects to make an average profit of 230,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is married with two children. She runs a general store while her husband does farming to make a living. She has been doing this for six years earning well to sustain the family. She joined GDMPC and recently borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. Her future dream is to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina has been operating her general store for four years to help her husband earn a living. She earns well from this business, which helps her family a lot. Her previous loans from GDMPC were used for her business.

Filomina always finds ways to improve her business. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve her business and wants to provide better living standards in the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Yaye Gadiaga

texts.fr: YAYE GADIAGA est une femme brave  qui habite dans le même quartier que le Guichet.  Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation de prêt à porter pour enfants, des parfums et des ustensiles. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandise et diversifier ses produits.  Elle n’a pas de charges particulières car c’est son mari qui prend en charges toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Ella a une expérience de 4ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h avec une pause de 14h à 16h. Elle souhaite grâce à l’aide de l’institution, renforcer et diversifier ses marchandises afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yaye Gadiaga is a courageous woman who lives in the same neighbourhood as the field partner.  She is 34 years old and married with children.  She sells ready-to-wear clothes for children, perfumes and utensils, and has four years experience in this business.  Yaye Gadiaga has requested this loan in order to increase her stocks of merchandise and expand the range of products that she offers.

She is not responsible for any particular expenses as her husband provides for all the daily expenses of their family.  Yaye Gadiaga begins work at nine in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.  She has a break between two and four in the afternoon.

Yaye Gadiaga would like to benefit from working with the field partner in order to strengthen and diversify her business.  In this way, she hopes to be able to increase her earnings and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy utensils and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Rowel

texts.en: Rowel is married with an only child living in Dela Paz Clarin with his family. He runs a transportation service when not in work and he earns a good income from this. He joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a new loan to fully pay for his motorcycle in addition to using his savings. His future plan is to buy another unit of vehicle to be used for his transportation services business.

loans.use: to add to his savings to pay for his motorcycle in full

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr: NDIAGA  est un homme âgé de 46 ans  qui évolue dans la confection des boubous qu’il revend à ses clients potentiels. Il est à son 1er prêt et voudrait ce montant pour acheter des tissus, fil, et des garnitures pour la confection des boubous qu’il revend à ses clients et expose le reste dans son atelier. Marié et père de famille il gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de la famille  ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Ayant une expérience de 10ans, il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Avec l’aide de l’institution, il voudrait diversifier ses produits afin d’augmenter ses revenus.  De ce fait il pourrait être autonome et gagner d’autres parts du marché.
texts.en:
Ndiaga is a 46-year-old man who makes boubous (traditional men's clothing) for resale to his customers.  He has ten years' experience in his business.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, and he will use it to buy fabric, thread and accessories to make boubous which he will sell directly to clients or through his workshop.

Ndiaga is married and has children.  He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family as well as the school fees of his children.  Ndiaga starts work at nine in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.

With the help of the field partner, Ndiaga  would like to expand the range of products he offers and increase his earnings.  This would enable him to be independent and conquer other sections of the market.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and accessories to make boubous for resale.

loans.name: El Hadji Ibrahima

texts.fr: EL HADJI IBRAHIMA est un homme qui habite dans le quartier ou se situe le guichet. Il est célibataire sans enfants. Agé de 31 ans, il évolue dans la commercialisation des prêts à porter pour les jeunes. Il a une expérience de 5ans dans cette activité et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des pantalons, chemises, body, jeans pour les revendre à ses clients. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa maman et de ses sœurs. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 22h. Il voudrait diversifier ses marchandises à l’avenir et grâce à l’aide de l’institution, augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir gagner plus d’argent et fonder une vie de famille.
texts.en:
El Hadji Ibrahima is a man who lives in the same neighbourhood as the field partner.  He is 31 years old, single and has no children.  He sells ready-to-wear clothing for young people, and has five years' experience in his business.

He has requested this loan in order to buy trousers, shirts, leotards and jeans for resale to his customers.  He is responsible for the daily expenses of his mother and his sisters.  El Hadji Ibrahima begins work at nine in the morning and finishes at ten in the evening.  

In the future, with the help of the field partner, he would like to diversify the range of clothing that he offers, in order to increase his earnings so that he can start a family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, jeans and leotards for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron bars, sand and bricks, and pay for the labor needed to build a room for her children.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
Efigenia es casada, no tiene hijos a su cargo, es una mujer emprendedora y visionaria, tiene un pequeño negocio como es la venta de zapatos en su casa de habitación.
Actualmente La Sra. Efigenia se presentó a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el cual lo utilizaría en gastos personales. Con este financiamiento es el Nº 13 con ceprodel  de los cuales ha ido mejorando su negocio, su vivienda y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Efigenia is a married woman who has no children. She is an entrepreneurial and visionary woman, and has a small business at home. She sells shoes.

Efigenia went to CEPRODEL to request a loan for personal use. This is her 13th loan with CEPRODEL. These loans have helped her to improve her business, her house and her personal life.

loans.use: to make some personal purchases.

loans.name: Sonia Guadalupe

texts.es: Sonia de 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijas, las cuales trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales, su negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa,  con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan,  Sonia solicita un crédito para la compra de masa, pollo, manteca, especias, hojas y de mas ingredientes,  para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sonia is 46 years old, she lives in her own home with her husband and her daughters, who work and help her financially. She works selling tamales. Her business is located in her home and she also does sales on foot around the different suburbs which are found near her house. With the income from her sales she manages to cover expenses which she has.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy dough, chicken, butter, spices, leaves and more ingredients, to be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy dough, chicken, butter, spices, leaves and more ingredients.

loans.name: Rene Alberto

texts.es: Rene de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 6 años se desempeña como motorista de microbús de transporte escolar, en donde transporta estudiantes hacia la escuela y viceversa, actividad que le ha permitido mantener la economía del hogar. Rene desea mejorar el servicio que brinda, por lo que solicita un crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en: herramientas y repuestos para su microbús y así prestar un servicio de mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rene of 31 years old lives in his own home with his 7 year old son. He is a very hardworking man who started working as a minibus driver doing school transportation, taking children to and from school, a job which has enabled him to keep his home running.

Rene wants to improve the service he offers, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: tools and spare parts for his minibus so he can offer a better quality service to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in: tools and spare parts for his minibus.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica  a la crianza de pollos de engorde, desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, María solicita un crédito para la compra de concentrado, vitaminas y antibióticos y la compra de mas pollos de engorde, para poder ampliar su negocio y así poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
María, 36, lives with her husband and children. She has been raising broilers for many years. She sells them at local markets and manages to cover some of the home expenses with her profits. 

María is requesting a loan to buy animal feed, vitamins, antibiotics and more broilers. She wants to expand her business in order to offer her family a more stable economy.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vitamins, antibiotics and more broilers.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es: Juana de 49 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio en buen funcionamiento, posee un taller de corte y confección, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Juana solicita un crédito para la compra de mas telas, hilos, encajes, zíper, botones, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and lives with her family in her own home. She has a business in good working order: a tailoring shop. With her business, she is able to she is able to manage the necessities and costs of her household.

Juana is asking for the loan to buy more fabric, thread, lace, zippers, buttons, etc. in order to continue her job and to be able to establish economic stability for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, thread, lace, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder es un joven muy entusiasta, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Asesor de créditos en un prestigioso banco y le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Eder en estos momentos necesita una laptop para poder avanzar con sus casos del trabajo y así mejorar su productividad, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar esta compra y así mejorar su trabajo. De esta manera seguirá luchando, podrá estudiar una carrera profesional y más adelante poner un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Eder is a very enthusiastic young man, he is 22 years old, single and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with his family. He is a person with a lot of desire to get ahead in life. For a year he has been working as a loan advisor at a prestigious bank and he's doing very well because he always makes an effort in everything that he does.

Eder needs a laptop at the moment to be able to move his work cases along and thus improve his productivity, so he is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered he will be able to make this purchase and thus improve at his work. In this way he will keep fighting, so he will be able to study a career path and later start his own business.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his work.

loans.name: Agripina Yamileth

texts.es:
Agripina, tienen un hogar en el que procura junto a su esposo cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos; de niña aprendió a elaborar tortillas, actualmente desempeña esta actividad para tener recursos económicos importantes para subsistir junto a sus hijos, durante el día realiza dos jornadas en su negocio, la primera de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. y la segunda de 4:00 a.m. a 6:00 a.m., por el momento no representa dificultades.
Para Agripina será de mucha ayuda el capital que requiere, lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, de esa manera contara con materia prima para que su negocio se mantenga funcionando, aprovechara el buen precio del producto antes que suban, por la pérdida de cultivos que enfrenta el país debido al mal invierno, espera mejorar su situación económica.
Sus sueños son construir un chalet en el que instalara su negocio para trabajar mejor, atender bien a sus clientes, pagar su deuda y mantener el apoyo económico a su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Agripina and her husband have a home in which they work together to meet the basic needs of their family. She lives with her husband and four children. When she was young she learned how to make tortillas, and she continues to do so in order to obtain the important economic resources to sustain her and her children. During the day, she has two shifts at work: the first is from 6 a.m. until 11 a.m., and the second is from 4 p.m. until 6 p.m. 

At the moment she does not have many difficulties. For Agripina, the loan will be a huge help to invest in purchasing corn, a raw material she needs in order to keep her business functioning. She really wants to take advantage of the good price of the product before it rises due to a loss of crops in her country (because of a bad winter). She hopes to better her economic situation. Her dreams are to build a villa for her business so she can work better, to take good care of her customers, to pay off her debts, and to assist her husband economically to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn as a raw material in order to keep her business functioning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Media Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MEDIA LUNA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ropa, venta de material de reciclaje, venta de polleras, panadería, tejido de chompas, venta de pantalones, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo heredo de su madre, pues ella trabajaba con estos productos, con el pasar del tiempo ella asumió el negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de tejer) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las compañeras en la institución.
texts.en:
The "Media Luna" communal bank is starting its second loan cycle at Pro Mujer's German Busch office. The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors that has Sonia as its president. The members of the communal bank have different businesses, including; selling milk, selling clothes, selling recyclable materials, selling sweatshirts, a bakery, knitting jumpers, selling trousers, and a grocery store.

This loan will benefit small business-owners in Sonia's group. Sonia herself says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, following an invitation from a neighbour who was already a member. Sonia currently has a business knitting blankets. She says that she inherited the business from her mother, who also worked with these products. Sonia gradually took over the business.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying a sewing machine from the traditional markets of El Alto city. Sonia will then install it in her workspace. This work allows Sonia to earn an income for her family. She is single and has one son. 

When asked what it is she likes  about Pro Mujer, Sonia says that she enjoys being with her colleagues at the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Eva Ruth

texts.es: Eva de 35 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su compañero de vida quien trabaja en una empresa privada, sus dos hijos y la suegra, ella se dedica a vender productos de uso personal, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Eva solicita un crédito para la compra de perfumería, lociones, cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores, desodorantes,  etc. y así poder continuar con sus ventas  y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eva is 35 years old and lives in a rented house with her partner - who works for a private business -, her two children, and her mother-in-law. Eva makes a living selling personal items. She has many customers because of the quality of her products, and the good prices. With profits from sales, Eva is able to  pay for household necessities. Eva is applying for a loan in order to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, conditioners, deodorants and more and to continue with her sales and offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, conditioners, deodorants and more.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: SEYNABOU est une femme qui est très brave et malgré ses 54 ans elle s’active toujours dans le marché. Elle vend des fruits et légumes et de l’huile de palme. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité et sollicite ce prêt de ce montant pour acheter des légumes et de l’huile de palme qu’elle va revendre dans son étale. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les charges scolaires de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle l’avenir elle souhaiter renforcer et diversifier ses marchandises et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent et d’améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
texts.en:
Seynabou is a very brave woman and despite being 54 years old, she works at the market every day. Seynabou sells fruits and vegetables and palm oil. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business and is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables and palm oil which she will resell in her display.

Seynabou is married and the mother of a family, and she helps her husband with the daily expenses and the schooling costs for her chilldren. She begins her day at 8am and works until 7pm. In the future, Seynabou hopes to expand her merchandise and increase her income to be able to save money and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and palm oil

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar papel de colores, pegamento, alambre, etc., para elaborar campanas, guirnaldas, banderas y otras decoraciones alusivas al mes cívico del país, de esta forma tendrá ingresos extras y aprovechara la temporada para mantenerse trabajando.
El préstamo anterior le dio la facilidad de comprar materiales para elaborar arreglos florarles para el día de difuntos, ha tenido mejores ventas e ingresos, mantiene un buen record crediticio, su familia tiene  una vida más confortable y  le apoyan en elaborar sus manualidades.
texts.en:
María has decided to apply for another loan in order to buy coloured paper, glue, wire and more, in order to make bells, flags and other decorations for El Salvador's upcoming "civic month". This will allow her to earn an extra income and to take advantage of the season in order to keep up her work.

María's previous loan allowed her to buy materials to make floral arrangements for the Day of the Dead, when she had a higher income and sales. María maintains a good credit rating, her family lives more comfortably now, and they support her with her handicraft work.

loans.use: to buy coloured paper, glue, wire and more, in order to make bells, flags and other decorations.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 31 años de edad es madre soltera habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos de 3, 8, 12 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 4 años se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de pupusas, actividad que realiza en su vivienda, y la cual le ha permitido darle solidez económica a su familia. Norma desea mejorar su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, loroco, aceite, maíz, harina de arroz, bebidas, etc. para su negocio de pupusas.
texts.en: Norma is 31 years old and a single mother. She lives in a home that she owns. She lives with her four children, who are fourteen, twelve, eight and three years old. Norma is an enterprising woman who, for four years, has made a living selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). She does this work from home and it has allowed her to provide her family with financial stability. Norma wants to improve her business and is therefore applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, oil, maize, rice flour, drinks and more.

loans.use: to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, oil, maize, rice flour, drinks and more.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 56 years old and a widow.

Aida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Aida has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
The group paid off their loan on time. They sold the pigs at a good price. Now the price for pork is about 26,000 IDR per kilogram. Ni Ayu, the head of the group, had three pigs and sold them all. She got a profit of 750,000 IDR after deducting her costs. She’s really grateful for that. Now she can use the profit to renovate her house little bit. During the last loan, she didn’t have any problems. All the pigs grew well. She said thank you to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

After successfully paying off the previous loan, the group is now taking another loan with the aim of improving their businesses. Ni Ayu, head of the group, coordinates the purchase of piglets to make sure all members get good piglets. With the loan, she purchased three of the local species of piglets which are used for pork barbeque and are sold every 2 months. 

Now is the right time to work in the rice field. So, in addition to using her loan to purchase piglets, Ni Ayu is also supporting her husband by purchasing rice seeds to plant in her rice field and fertilizer. 

She hopes the two of her business will go well. From the results of these efforts, she hopes to buy floors for her home as the ones she has now are still cement.

loans.use: to purchase three of the local species of piglets, rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 54 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with 11 children of whom 9 are now adults and the other two are still of school age. 

For the past ten years, Junie has been engaged in managing a vehicle repair shop together with his wife. He earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional flux, copper and other accessories and materials for their vehicle repair shop business.

Junie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 6 months. In the future, Junie hopes to expand their vehicle repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional flux, copper and other accessories and materials.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also operates a carinderia (a food stall in the Philippines) and earns well from this.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. She will also purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her food stall business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emily hopes to manage her own restaurant someday for she desires to give her grandchildren a better future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor is 65 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married with 4 children who are adults. Melchor has been engaged in managing a welding repair shop together with his wife for 28 years already and earns approximately PHP15,000 each month doing this type of business activity.

He has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper and other accessories and materials for his welding repair shop business. Melchor has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Melchor hopes to expand his welding repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper and other accessories and materials.

loans.name: Jacquelin

texts.en:
Jacquelin is managing her eatery business in Molave, Zamboanga Del Sur. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. It has been doing well and supports the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts to do catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy if she could open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has signed up for his membership with PMPC and availed himself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to him. Samson is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. 

He wants to take advantage of his good fortune. Recently he availed himself of a loan to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad  se dedica desde hace 10 años a la  venta de papas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, vive en casa propia con el esposo el cual le ayuda con su negocio y con tres hijos los cuales dependen económicamente y estudian actualmente, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar. María solicita un crédito para la compra de papas por mayor para comercializándolas y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 42, has worked for the past ten years selling potatoes.  Her business is located in the market near her home.  She lives in her own home with her husband, who helps with her business.  She also lives with three children, all of whom are financially dependent on her; they are students.  With the earnings she gets from her sales she manages to keep up with the household expenses.  

María is asking for a loan to buy potatoes in bulk in order to sell them.  In this way, she can have a better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Jenit

texts.en:
Jenit is married with two children and is 40 years old. She works in an insurance company and at the same time manages a general store in her village for a living. She has been in this business for five years and was able to sustain it. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC to have additional capital to buy dried fish for her sari sari store. She is hoping to have her business improve to ensure better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to have additional capital so as to buy dried fish for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Los Almendros  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Almendros. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellos decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios y su  calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Santa, tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 18 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Santa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos espera utilizar este crédito para comenzar con un negocio de venta de zapatos y sandalias de todo tipo,  tiene varios conocidos que le están encargando los productos, ella también espera darle parte del crédito a su marido el cual también se dedica a la venta de gafas, CD de música y películas, el se desplaza a otras ciudades a vender estos producto y lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad.  Ella espera que este negocio le sirva para ganar algo por  el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatos, sandalias y gafas para el negocio del marido. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta la oportunidad para comenzar un negocio propio. Sus sueños es que su negocio sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the “Los Almendros” credit group meet in El Florón, in the city of Portoviejo.  These same people work in various jobs such as trade or services, among others.  They decided to get together and start this credit group in order to improve their businesses and quality of life.  One of the group members is Santa.  She is 38 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  From this relationship she has two children, ages 15 and 18.  They are high school students.  Her partner is a salesman.

With the goal of having her own income, Santa hopes to use this loan to start a business selling all types of shoes and sandals.  She has various acquaintances who are ordering her products.  She hopes that this business will help her to earn something for the good of her family.  She also hopes to give some of the loan to her partner, who works selling glasses, music CDs, and movies.  He has been doing this for more than ten years, traveling to other cities to sell his products. 

She is going to use this loan to buy shoes and sandals, as well as glasses for her husband’s business.  This is her first loan cycle with the credit group, and she likes having the chance to start her own business.  Her dream is that her business would be successful.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, and glasses.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en:
Ronila is 38 years old with five children, four of whom are in school. Ronila works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines and requested a 8000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc.

Ronila has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Ronila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Flor De Munaypata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE MUNAYPATA” iniciará el vigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carnicería, venta de salchipapas, venta de herramientas para vehículos, venta de frutas, pensión familiar, venta de condimentos, tejido de mantas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa (comida boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos y al observar el negocio de su sobrina decide implementar este mismo en su zona. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de kiosco) que adquirirá de los fabricantes Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra acompañando al grupo la hija de una de las clientas ella esta con una gorra negra.
texts.en:
The communal bank Flor de Munaypata is starting it's 21st cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of which Alejandra is the secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal bank vary, including: butchers, salchipapas sales, vehicle tools sales, fruit sales, a guesthouse, spice sales, rug weaving, food sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small women micro-entrepreneurs where Alejandra is a member. She says that five years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of an adviser from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Currently she has a business selling salchipapas (a Bolivian food). She reveals that she learnt the business out of the need to generate a financial income and seeing her cousin's business she decided to start her own one in her area.

The loan they are requesting now is to increase capital (to buy a kiosk) which will be purchased from manufacturers in the City of El Alto and then installed in her sales space. This kind of work allows her to generate income to financially support her family, as she is single and has one child.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and the health field that the institution offers.

In the photo, the daughter of one of the members appears with the group, she is wearing a black cap.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Grace is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Grace has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Grace requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a printer and other spare parts for her business.

Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and other spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Anatolia Blanca

texts.es: Anatolia payed her previous loan on time and now is asking for an additional loan to continue investing in her food stall, she will buy some disposable products and also some inputs that she uses for cooking. She has been in business for close to ten years and she has been able to provide financial stability to her family.
texts.en: Anatolia payed her previous loan on time and now is asking for an additional loan to continue investing in her food stall. She will buy some disposable products and also some inputs that she uses for cooking. She has been in business for close to ten years and she has been able to provide financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Norma Areli

texts.es: Norma vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia, ella es una persona honesta, trabajadora y muy responsable, posee una tienda y un molino, su negocio lo tiene bien ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de su tienda logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos de su hogar, Norma solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos para comprar más mercadería para su tienda como: jabón, detergente, gaseosas, jugos, arroz, queso, frijoles, etc. y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband and children in her own home. She is an honest, hardworking and very responsible person. She has a store and a mill, her business is in a good location close to where she lives.

With what she makes in her store, she is able to cover the basics and the expenses of her family. Norma is requesting a loan to buy more products, to buy more merchandise for her store like: soap, detergent, soda, juice, rice, cheese, beans, etc. and thus be able to give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, soda, juice, rice, cheese, beans, etc.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. Five of her children are in school.

Gerly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice. 

Gerly requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gerly has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Gerly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married and she has three children. Tita is 66 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo,Sinacaban, Philippines.

Tita is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

She has requested a loan to buy two sacks of feeds and repair the piggery house.
  
Tita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Tita hopes to save more for consumption.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of feeds and repair the piggery house.

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny lives in Panta-on, Ozamiz City, with his family. He has two children and he runs a buy and sell business in order to sustain their living. He buys and sells copra (dried coconut meat) and charcoal in town in volume. 

To buy more stocks, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit. He will save some portion of his returns to buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of copra and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own ready-to-wear business for years, and she earns well from this. She had to work hard with the determination to have a better income. 

To improve sales, Elvira would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. At an amount of PHP 20,000, she could purchase more quantity of men's, women's and children's clothing and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she hopes that her business will continue to operate and help with their everyday needs and expenses. She dreams for her grandchildren to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is married with three children. Franklin is 40 years old and lives in Duanguican Tudela, Philippines.

Franklin sells assorted goods in a general store to earn a living. He has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to restock his store with basic commodities.

Franklin has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Franklin hopes to expand his business and save more money.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with 11 children, of whom three are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 43 years old.

Lolita has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Lou works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from general store. 

Mary Lou is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like woods, paints, nails, etc. for her furniture-making business.

Mary Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like woods, paints, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 63 years old and married with five children.  

Adelaida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Adelaida has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Founation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adelaida has been farming calamansi for10 years now. She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Emprendedor y trabajador, son las palabras que identifican a Julio Cesar, quien desde los ocho años de edad, trabaja con su papá en el campo sembrando frijoles. Al mismo tiempo, estudiaba su primaria, sin embargo, al finalizar esa primera etapa del colegio tuvo que separarse de los estudios debido a problemas económicos. Al llegar a la mayoría de edad decidió formar su familia y emprender en la agricultura por sí solo. Ahora, con 20 años de experiencia, puede brindarles a sus seis hijos de las edades entre 3 a 18 años, la educación que él no pudo tener. 
Afortunadamente Julio cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, en especial cuando tiene que viajar a Costa Rica para trabajar o cuando necesita vender terneros. Su sueño es dar a conocer su producto en mercados donde los precios se mantengan fijos, pues así tendría clientes permanentes. En estos momentos se acerca la nueva siembra por lo que necesita de un préstamo para comprar 10 litros de glifosato, 10 litros de gramoxon, 8 litros de hierbicida, 10 litros de refrescante, 3 quintales de abono como urea, materiales que le permitirán garantizar una excelente producción y grandes ganancias en su cosecha de frijoles. En sus planes está comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Entrepreneurial and hardworking, these are the words that describe Julio Cesar, who from eight years old, worked with his father on the farm planting beans. At the same time he went to primary school, however after finishing this first stage of school he had to leave his education due to financial problems. When he came of age he decided to start his own family and start farming on his own. Now, with 20 years experience, he can offer his six children between 3 and 18 years old, the education that he couldn't have. 

Luckily, Julio can count on the support of his family, especially when he has to travel to Costa Rica for work or when he needs to sell calves. His dream is to have his products reach markets where the prices are stable, as then he will have regular customers. 

At the moment the new planting season is approaching so he needs a loan to buy 10 liters of glyphosate and 10 liters of gramoxon [herbicides], 10 liters of foliar fertilizer, 3 bushels of fertilizers such as urea, supplies which will allow him to guarantee excellent production and great earnings in his bean harvest.

His plans are to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy herbicides.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
To make a living, Susan helps her husband working on their own farm. She has been doing this for many years as their main source of income and she was able to provide for the family. With their farm income, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated through her loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Hilden

texts.en:
Hilden is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

Hilden works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Hilden requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hilden aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Justin has been in this business for eight years now.

Justin requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Justin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun is 27 years old, and married, living with her three children and her husband in Takeo Province of Cambodia. 

She is a food and vegetables seller. She has been in this business since 2010. Her husband is 33, a taxi driver. Two of her children are students. 

Together, she and her husband can earn approximately $28 per day.  Now Nun would like to request a loan to build a bathroom. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions.

In the future, she wants to carry vegetables to sell at the market in the city and build one more bedroom for her child.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Gina has been raising livestock for 26 years and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her business

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 48 years old and married with four children.

Marciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Marciana has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Marciana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is 59 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Camila is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Camila has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients and vegetables for her business.

Carmel has been in this business for 10 years. Carmel earns more income from raising pigs.

Carmel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Faridakhon

texts.ru: Фаридахон замужняя женщина в возрасте 44 лет. Она уроженка района Кубадиён. Фаридахон и ее семья занимаются животноводством и сельским хозяйством. Бизнес куплю-продажу скотов ее семья начала два года назад. Это прибыльный бизнес со стабильным доходом, не зависящий от сезона. Чтобы продолжить эту деятельность Фаридахон запрашивает кредит. В ее хозяйстве в данное время не осталось скота для откорма и продажи. Поэтому на сумму кредита Фаридахон хочет приобрести бычка. Этот кредит ей действительно важен для продолжения деятельности животноводства.
texts.en: Faridakhon is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a native of the Qubadiyon District. Faridakhon and her family practice livestock breeding and farming. Her family started their business of buying and selling livestock two years ago. This is a profitable business with a steady income, regardless of the season. In order to continue this business, Faridakhon is requesting a loan. She currently does not have any cattle left on her farm to fatten up and resell. This is why Faridakhon wants to use the loan to buy a bull calf. This loan is truly important for her so that she can continue her livestock breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf to continue her livestock breeding business.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 27 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelyn has been in pig fattening for 2 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Maria Liza has been in this business for 2 years. Maria Liza earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sher Ann

texts.en:
Sher Ann is a 34-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Sher Ann has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear items like bags, watches, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sher Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, Sher Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear like bags, watches, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is 27 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Carmel has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carmel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmel has been in this business for 4 years. Carmel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Savoeun is 49 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her four children and her husband in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1986. Her husband is 51 years old, and he is also a farmer. Two of her children are garment workers and one is a policeman. Together, they can earn approximately $22 per day. Now Savoeun would like a loan to build a toilet. This loan will help her family live in better and hygienic conditions. In the future, she is going to open a small shop for her children, design clothes and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Reparto Andres Vega Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran tres microempresarias triunfadoras, una de ellas es la señora María Teodora de 31 años de edad y soltera, ofrece el servicio de venta de comida (fritanga) en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años y solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, carne de res, carne de cerdo, repollo, zanahoria, carne de pollo, accesorios para guardar los alimentos, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras, Seneyda quien tiene la edad de 26 años y se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio y Yadira de 37 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank is comprised of three winning small businesswomen.  María Teodora is one of them.  She is 31 years old and single.  She provides food service (snack bar) at her house.  She started this business four years ago.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, green bananas, sweet plantains, beef, and accessories to keep the food, etc.

Seneyda, another member, is 26 years old.  She makes and sells tortillas at her house.  

Yadira, the other member, is 37 years old.  She sells clothes in her community.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, green bananas, sweet plantains, beef, and accessories to keep the food, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 66 years old, married, and a resident of Villa Consuelo, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have nine children. Starting with a capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari store (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the other benefits provided by the co-op. She became a member in April 2013 and has taken out three loans.  Now she is applying for 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, mainly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart some day.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store (general store), mainly basic commodities.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie is 42 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband and has three children of school age. Merlie has been engaged in the hog-fattening business for almost three years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from this business activity. At present she has two sows. She has applied for a loan to be used in purchasing wire, outlets and a meter for her house, and the remainder will be used to pay for installation fees and building permits. Merlie has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Merlie hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing wire, outlets and a meter for her house, and to pay for installation fees and building permits.

loans.name: Efrenia

texts.en:
Efrenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

NWTF is listing Efrenia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella works hard to support her family. Ella is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ella requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Ella has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 53-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a pillow-making business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelia is 55 years old. Her children are in school. Emelia has a general store business in the Philippines. Emelia applied for a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Emelia has been in this business for five years. Emelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 27 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jane has a general store business in the Philippines. Jane requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as shampoo, juice, milk, chocolate drink, coffee, beer, soft-drinks, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jane has been in this business for four years. Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as shampoo, juice, milk, chocolate drink, coffee, beer, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Reseda Group

texts.es: Al grupo Flor de Reseda lo integran tres mujeres esforzadas en sus labores cotidianos lo que las ha convertido en microempresarias exitosas, es coordinado por la señora Heissell quien tiene la edad de 32 años es propietaria de un taller de zapatería en su domicilio  y el crédito lo solicita para a compra de material sintético, cuero, suelas, hebillas, pega blanca, pega amarilla, etc., con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene de este producto. Otra socia es la señora Ana de 58 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y refresco y la señora Yaritza quien tiene la edad de 36 años y es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos y perecederos
texts.en:
The Flor de Reseda group is comprised of three women who work hard in their daily business activities.  By doing so, they have become successful small businesswomen.  

Heissell is the coordinator.  She is 32 years old, and she has a shoe workshop at her house.  She is requesting the loan to buy synthetic material, leather, soles, clasps, white glue, and yellow glue, etc.  She will do this in order to cover the demand that she has for this product.

Ana, age 58, is another member.  She sells soft drinks and refreshments.

Yaritza, age 36, has a store at her house.  She will use the requested loan to buy basic grains and perishables.

loans.use: to buy synthetic material, leather, soles, clasps, white glue, and yellow glue, etc.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania has a variety business selling "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) in Larena, Philippines. Her business is doing well and she wants to take advantage of the promising sales it gives. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

Recently, Melania took another loan from PMPC, to buy bundles of used clothing to sell. Someday, she plans to buy a motor unit for family use.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa has a food vending business in Larena. She has mastered the business, and it has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently she loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.
