loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is 24 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Lizel works very hard to provide for them.

Lizel's business was devastated by super-typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lizel is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Lizel has requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Lizel is committed to rebuilding, and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products like canned goods, milk, chips, soap, etc

loans.name: Carol Jane

texts.en:
Carol Jane is 36 years old and resides in Larena, Siquijor. She is married, and manages a sari-sari store. 

She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. She is happy to have her house repaired out from her savings. 

Recently, she's accessing another loan  to buy a variety of basic food commodities to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic commodities

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion makes a living through a retail business. She runs a lumber yard in Larena and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has availed herself of a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. She hopes to sustain her business and dreams of purchasing a delivery truck someday.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Mariche

texts.en:
Mariche is 30 years old, married, and lives in Larena. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs in her own backyard.  

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. 

Now she requests a loan to buy additional bags of feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Jennifer is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, cooking oil and other groceries.

Jennifer successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, cooking oil and other groceries

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette works hard to support her family.

She has a direct business, selling Avon and personal collections in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from a buy and sell ready to wear and a general store. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nanette is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to  purchase more Avon and personal collection products to sell for her direct selling Avon and personal collection products business.

Nanette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase Avon products and personal collection products

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Emie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell cattle business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Emie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cattle to sell for her buy and sell cattle business.

Emie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle to sell

loans.name: Glenie

texts.en:
Glenie is 37 years old and has a live-in partner with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Glenie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with 2 children aged between 6 and 10 years old. He describes himself as disciplined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle, and he has been involved in this business for 3 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a second-hand motocycle. His business goal is to be successful in the future and to become prosperous within 5 years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motocycle

loans.name: Dinas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Dina lo integran cuatro mujeres con espíritu de superación, y es coordinado por la señora Esther de 31 años quien es propietaria de un taller zapatería, además de fabricarlo los comercializa en los departamentos del país, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuero sintético, pega amarilla, pega blanca, cajuelas, suelas, mantenimiento de maquinarias, etc., una de sus metas es aumentar su productividad. Otra de las socias es la señora Patricia de 29 años quien se dedica a la comercialización de calzado, los compra al por mayor y los comercializa en los mercados de los departamentos del país, la señora Yadira de 41 años de edad quien comercializa ropa y churros de miel en su comunidad y Abigail de 41 años de edad comerciante de zapatos en los departamentos del país.
texts.en:
The Dina group is composed of four women with a spirit of self-improvement. It´s coordinated by Esther who is 31 years old and owns a shoe shop. In addition to making the shoes, she sells them in different areas throughout the country. She´s asking for this loan to buy synthetic leather, yellow glue, white glue, trunks and soles, and for the maintenance of her machines, etc. One of her goals is to increase her productivity. 

One of the other members is 29-year-old Patricia who sells footwear. She buys them in bulk and sells them in markets throughout the country. 

Yadira is 41 years old and she sells clothes and honey churros in her community.

Abigail is 41 years old and she sells shoes throughout the country.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shoe shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is managing her eatery business in Larena. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This business has been doing well to support the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en: From Larena, Jacquiline earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventory to conitnuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. She hopes to live comfortably and save more for her retirement.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer. With her farm, Rosela and her husband provide for the needs of their family. The couple work hard to improve their situation. Rosela took a new loan recently to cover farm fertilization costs. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover farm fertilization costs

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a female Kiva borrower who describes herself as faithful and dedicated to her work. She operates a chemist's where she sells medicine, and she has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to open another branch within 5 years, and she hopes that in the future her financial status will improve. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: To buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: ROKHAYA est une femme âgée de 31 ans qui évolue dans la commercialisation des  produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des produits cosmétiques comme les laits de corps, les parfum, les savons etc.. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle voudrait avec l’aide de l’institution améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en augmenter ses revenus et épargner beaucoup d’argent
texts.en:
Rokhaya is a 31-year-old woman who has been selling cosmetic products for more than three years.  She is married and has children.

Rokhaya has requested this loan in order to buy cosmetic products such as body creams, perfumes, soaps, etc.  She helps her husband to provide for the daily expenses of their household, and the school fees of their children.  She begins work at eight in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.

Rokhaya would like to use the support of the field partner to improve the living conditions of her family, increase her earnings and save a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is single and lives with her parents. She sells cosmetics in the villages to make a living. Doing this for six years, Manilyn has been able to sustain the business activity and serve her costumers well. She collects payments weekly using her motorcycle. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy additional cosmetics and pay for motor maintenance costs. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics and pay for motor maintenance costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 34 years old. She is known in the Larena area for her snack vending business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the Co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be future-oriented and honest. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a leading hotel. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be future-oriented and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereals shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a leading cereals business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 58 years old and married with eight children.

Eva is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 49 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Marlyn's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marlyn is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Marlyn has requested a 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Marlyn is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop

loans.name: San Pedro De Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN PEDRO DE SANTIAGO” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de artículos varios, tienda de abarrotes, carpintería, venta de ropa, venta de accesorios de celulares, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace seis años, iniciando con un pequeño capital. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se observa una señora que acompaña al grupo, ella esta vestida con una chompa negra
texts.en:
The communal bank "SAN PEDRO DE SANTIAGO" will begin its 28th Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Santiago II Social Center.  The group comprises eight members and their board of directors is led by Teodora, the president.  The members are involved in different business activities: food sales, sweater sales, miscellaneous items sales, a grocery store, a carpentry shop, clothing sales, cell phone accessories sales and transport services.

The loan will benenfit small business owners, such as Teodora who says she has been a member of the Pro Mujer group for 15 years.  She joined by invitation through a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  Her current business is selling food; she started the activity six years ago with a small amount of capital.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her work capital to buy rice and noodles wholesale from dealers in the city of La Paz.  She will use the goods to sell at her food stall.  Through her work she is able to generate resources to support her family economically, since she has a common-law husband and four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the savings offered by the institution.

In the photo she is the lady wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: To buy rice and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc. to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Elsie María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad,  una de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es Ing. Civil.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica  a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, sandalias y perfumes, vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando le llega mercadería nueva la misma que recibe desde los Estados Unidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio por lo cual tiene buena clientela. Ella también en su casa prepara almuerzos y entrega a domicilio,
Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar ropa, perfumes y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva cuatro años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando sus negocios.
texts.en:
The credit group Caña Brava 24 De Mayo meets in the canton of 24 De Mayo in the province of Manabí. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people, who make their living in agriculture and animal husbandry. 
Here lives María; she is 53 years old, is married, and has three adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a civil engineer. 
María is a woman who likes to stand on her own two feet and earn her own income to help with the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothing, shoes, and perfumes. She receives her merchandise from the United States, and her customers go to her house when she gets new merchandise. She sells on credit and collects from her customers weekly. She has been in this business for over 10 years, so she has a good clientele. Another business that she has is preparing lunches for home delivery. 
This loan will be used to buy clothes and perfumes, and food to prepare meals. She has been in this credit group for four years and she likes it because she receives the loans quickly and they help a lot. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, and food.

loans.name: Passyam Group

texts.fr:
Mme SABINE représente le groupe BASSYAM.  ZALISSA se porte bien mais ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, SABINE est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz de 50kg et 05cartons de spaghetti pour sa restauration.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un réfrigérateur  et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Sabine is the representative for the Bassyam Group.  Zalissa is doing well but is no longer part of the group.  Sabine is married and mother to five children, four of whom currently attend school.  The eldest is fifteen years old and the youngest is one year old.  

Sabine has been running her restaurant business for six years.  She buys her supplies at the local market.  She will use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of rice and five boxes of spaghetti for her restaurant.  She plans to reinvest her profits into her business.  Her ambition is to be able to buy a refrigerator and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of 50 kg rice and 5 boxes of  spaghetti for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Las Violetas Y El Girasol Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” está conformado por socios empeñosos en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Luz tiene 33 años de edad es casada con 1 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace varios años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza  que estén en oferta y poderlos expender a un precio que le genere ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Luz es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste chompa marrón.
texts.en: The “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” communal bank is composed of members who are determined to improve the quality of living for their families. Luz is 33 years old, married and has one dependent child. She has worked selling beauty products for several years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of beauty products that are on sale and she can retail them at a price that generates a profit. The group is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the loan. Luz is the second to the left wearing the brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”  está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras dedicadas al comercio minorista. Marisol  tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a su bodega que implemento hace varios años en su vivienda y a la vez expende productos de belleza a través de catálogos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y productos de belleza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el crédito brindado. Marisol es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The communal bank "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN" is a group of women who work in retail commerce.  Marison, 41, lives with her common-law husband and three dependent children.  She runs a store she set up in her home several years ago and also sells beauty products by catalogue.  She will use the loan to buy groceries and beauty products.  The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Marison is the first one on the left.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and beauty products.

loans.name: Abdou Salam

texts.fr: ABDOU SALAM est un jeune homme âgé de 30ans. Il habite aux environs du guichet et évolue dans la menuiserie. Il  est marié et père de famille qui gère l’ensemble des charges quotidiennes de sa famille. Il demande ce crédit pour acheter du matériel de menuiserie comme le bois et les accessoires qui s’en suivent. Il a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa  journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Il confectionne des lits et armoires pour les commandes de ses clients et parfois expose des armoires. Il voudrait à l’avenir diversifier les produits et service en augmentant le nombre de ses employés et satisfaire ses clients. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abdou Salam is a 30-year-old man.  He lives locally to the field partner and has worked as a furniture maker for more than ten years.  Abdou Salam is married, has children and is responsible for providing for all the day-to-day expenses of his family.  He has requested this loan in order to buy supplies such as wood and other accessories, for his furniture making business.

Abdou Salam starts his working day at eight in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.  He makes beds and wardrobes to order for his customers, and sometimes makes wardrobes to expose for sale.  

In the future, he would like to diversify the products and services which he offers, by employing more workers.  This would lead to greater customer satisfaction, increase his revenue and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture for his clients and his workshop.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as future-oriented and honest. Rosemary operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in urban area and her biggest business challenge is inadequate stock. She will use the KES20,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, her shop will be a market leader. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Flores De Chacaltaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE CHACALTAYA” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paola es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, librería, carnicería, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, venta de ropa, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos y al observar que estos productos eran ampliamente comercializados en el mercado. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de la frontera Perú – Bolivia y posteriormente comercializará a pedido de la cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLORES DE CHACALTAYA" will begin its seventh Pro Mujer cycle at the Alto Lima social center.  The group consists of eight members and its board of directors is led by Paola, the secretary.  The members are involved in different businesses, among which are: cosmetic sales, a bookstore, a butcher shop, a grocery store, blanket weaving, clothing sales and blanket macrame.

The loan will benefit small business owners, including Paola who says she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago by invitation through a representative from the institution who visited her at home.  She currently is in business selling cosmetics.  She says she started the activity because she needed to earn an income and she saw that these products were widely sold on the market.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital to buy cosmetics at the border between Peru and Bolivia.  Later she will sell them to customers on an order basis.  Through her work she is able to generate resources to support her family economically.  She is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the health area training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María es madre de tres hijos ya independientes de ella pero con altos estándares humanos de ética y sentido de responsabilidad social, apasionada por la ciencia, motivada por el servicio a los demás, sin temores a enfrentar los retos que propone la complejidad del conocimiento, inteligente y hábil para interpretar el mundo que la rodea; creativa, sensible, disciplinada y constante en la búsqueda de soluciones para los problemas de salud y el bienestar de las personas que llegan a su centro de trabajo por una pastilla, una inyección, sueros orales entre otros productos. Actualmente Ana María solicita un préstamo para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera en Lic. Química Farmacéutica y de esta manera culminarla con éxito para luego emprender con muchos ánimos su propio negocio de venta de productos farmacéuticos.
texts.en:
Ana María is the mother of three children who are now independent. She has high human ethical standards and a sense of social responsibility and is passionate about science. She is motivated by service for others and not afraid to face the challenges that the complexities of knowledge bring. She is intelligent and skillful in interpreting the world around her. She is creative, sensible and disciplined. She constantly searches for solutions to health problems and the well-being of people who come to her work place for a pill, injection, oral re-hydration solution amongst other products.

Ana María is requesting a loan to pay for her courses in Pharmaceutical Sciences and thus successfully completing her studies and later enthusiastically start her own business selling pharmaceutical products.

loans.use: to pay her university courses.

loans.name: Wuyetegue 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  WUYETEGUE 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKO un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SOUNGALO débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  WUYETEGUE 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Wuyetegue 1 Group are all married men who are, on average, 45 years old and have 7 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of N'Goloko, Dogoni commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second production loan to grow maize.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Soungalo (standing second from the right in the photo) grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy eight 50kg sacks of fertilizer, ten drums of differing qualities of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work one hectare of land.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Soungalo expects to earn an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Falaba 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe FALABA 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à M'PELA un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur DRISSA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme FALABA 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Falaba 1 Group are all married men who are, on average, 42 years old and have 6 children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of M'Pela, Dogoni commune, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

The group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  This will be their second production loan to grow maize.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

Drissa (standing on the left in the photo) grows maize.  He plans to use his loan to buy eight 50kg sacks of fertilizer, ten drums of differing qualities of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work one hectare of land.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Drissa expects to earn an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a single man. He describes himself as future-oriented and honest. He operates a barber shop, where he does haircutting. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a haircutting machine. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a haircutting machine. His business goal is to have a big barber shop within five years. He hopes that he will have the leading barber shop in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a haircutting machine

loans.name: Elsa Lucia

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de  una hija de 15 años que  estudian en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Elsa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia, ella tiene un almacén de venta de telas, sabanas, toallas, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su papá, ya son más de 7 años con este almacén con el cual sale adelante ella sola y saca adelante a su hija. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y toallas. Lleva más de 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio con el cual se gana la vida.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabi is the "24 de Mayo" Canton which is where the communal bank "Cana Brava de 24 de Mayo" meets.  The location is known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal farming.

This is where Elsa, 36, lives.  She is a single mother whose 15-year-old daughter attends school.  She lives with her parents.

Elsa is a very hard-working woman who likes to earn her own income for the well-being of her family.  She has a shop where she sells fabrics, sheets, towels and other items.  She works every day with the help of her father and has been running the store for seven years, providing for herself and her daughter.  The loan is to buy fabrics and towels.  

Elsa has been a member of the communal bank for five years and she enjoys it because she is able to finance the business which gives her a source of income.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and towels.

loans.name: Miryam Alexandra

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Miryan, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 12 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Miryam es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a  su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo,  él se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de maíz y maní y cuenta con terrenos apropiados para sembrar en toda época del año, trabaja solo ya que no es mucho el trabajo para contratar más personal, ella le ayuda en sus faenas cuando puede y así aprovecha para pasar el tiempo junto  a su esposo.
Este crédito es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes  e insecticidas para obtener una muy buena cosecha. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudar con la dura carga del hogar. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabi is the "24 de Mayo" Canton where every fifteen days the communal bank "Cana Brava de 24 de Mayo" meets.  The location is known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal farming.

Miryam is a very good wife who helps her husband and she is requesting a loan for him to use in his work.  He works in agriculture and grows corn and peanuts.  He owns his own land where he plants all year long.  He works alone because there is not enough activity to hire an employee.  She helps with the chores when she can and takes advantage of the time to spend with her husband. 

This loan is to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to obtain a good harvest.  She has been in the communal bank for five loan cycles and likes the fact that it helps her with the heavy load of running a household.  Her dream is to give her family the best she can.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has two children ages 4 and 7 years. He describes himself to be business oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. He will use the KES 94,500 loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can start a transport business. His business goal is to be a major meat supplier within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 49 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them. Mercy's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mercy is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. She has requested a PHP3,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell. Mercy is committed to rebuilding and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as soap, milk, chips, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Bamby

texts.fr: BAMBY est une femme jeune mariée qui est âgée de 25 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le guichet et évolue dans la commercialisation de denrées alimentaires comme le sucre, huile, savon de liquide, bonbons et les revend. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 22h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Il voudrait  avoir un magasin  d’alimentation générale afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bamby is a young, married woman.  She is 25 years old and has two children.  She lives in the neighbourhood where the field partner is based, and sells basic food items such as sugar, oil, liquid soap and sweets.

Bamby is not responsible for any particular expenses apart from her personal costs.  She starts work at seven in the morning and finishes at ten in the evening.

Bamby has requested this loan to increase her stock holding and diversify the range of products which she offers.  She would like to have a general food store and, therefore, improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic food items such as rice, sugar, liquid soap and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores e independientes. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Rosa es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a  su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene cultivos de maíz, maní y verduras, siembra en toda época del año ya cuenta con terrenos apropiados, actualmente está por realizar trabajos de desbrotes y limpieza de los cultivos para lo cual necesita del crédito para pagar la mano de obra. Gracias a los frutos que la tierra les da ellos salen adelante.
Este crédito es para pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para obtener una muy buena cosecha. Lleva cuatro años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son salir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabi is the "24 de Mayo" Canton, where every fifteen days the communal bank "Cana Brava de 24 de Mayo" meets. The location is known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal farming.

This is where Rosa, 54, lives.  She has a common-law husband and four independent adult children.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Rosa is a very good wife who plans to use the loan to help her husband in his work.  He grows corn, peanuts and vegetables, and plants all year long on his own land.  Now is the time to clean the fields and remove weeds, so the loan is to hire labor.  Thanks to the income from their land they are able to get ahead.

This loan is to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer for a good harvest.  Rosa has been in the communal bank for four years because it helps her family prosper.  Her goals are to get ahead and to have good health.

loans.use: To pay labor costs and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur SEYDOU est né en Décembre 1976 à SOUROUKOUDINGUE, marié, père de 5 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à LOBOUGOULA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 20 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 4 hectares.
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau de village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 640 000 francs CFA par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Seydou was born in December 1976 in Souroukoudingue.  He is married and has five children.  He lives with his wife and children in a traditional family in the commune of Lobougoula, Sikasso district (the third administrative region of Mali).

Seydou works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve his agricultural business during the winter season.  This will be his second production loan to grow maize.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

He plans to use his loan to buy sixteen 50kg sacks of fertilizer, twenty drums of differing qualities of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work four hectares of land.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Seydou expects to earn an average profit of 640,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable him to repay his loan and interest, and contribute to the daily expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “ADELANTE COCACHACRA” están dedicados al comercio minorista a prestar servicios. Nataly tiene 30 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda y a la vez presta servicios de mantenimiento.  Es de esta manera que puede sostener a sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes azúcar arroz aceite y bebidas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nataly es la segunda persona parada del lado izquierdo viste cafarena negra.
texts.en:
The members of the group 'Adelante Cocachacra' work in retail and in services. 

Nataly is 30 years old, and is single with 2 children who are dependent. She runs a store out of her house, and at the same time provides maintenance services. It is in this way that she is able to sustain her children.

The loan will be used in the purchase of stock groceries like sugar, rice, oil and drinks. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan. Nataly is the second person standing from the left side seen in black.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, oil and drinks.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre trabajador, es soltero, tiene 45 años de edad y vive en Pueblo Nuevo junto a su familia. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder sacar adelante a su familia porque quiere brindarles un futuro mejor. Tiene 2 pequeños hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes siempre lucha para ofrecerles una educación de calidad y mejores oportunidades que él no pudo tener cuando era pequeño.
Desde hace más de 4 años trabaja brindando servicios de chofer - colectivo y le va muy bien porque siempre brinda una atención personalizada y se preocupa por la seguridad de sus clientes.
Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una cocina para regalar a su madre y de esta manera pueda tener mayor seguridad al momento de cocinar, gracias a ello estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para más adelante ver a sus hijos conertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Victor, 45, is a hard-working, single man who lives in Pueblo Nuevo with his family.  From a very early age he has worked to provide for his family and give them a better future.  He has two small children who are his greatest pride who he always works hard for so they can receive a quality education and better opportunities than what he had when he was young.

For four years he has been working as a driver and it is going well for him because of the personalized attention he gives to customers along with a concern for their safety.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because hanks to their support he will be able to buy a stove for his mother.  This will give her greater safety when cooking.  Thanks to this, Victor will improve his quality of life and continue striving to see his children become great professionals.

loans.use: To buy a stove for his wife.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 28 años de edad, está  separada y de esa relación tiene  dos hijos de 7 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan para salir adelante.
Doña Diana  es una muy buena madre que lucha cada día para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, hace seis años instalo un pequeño bar en su casa, allí tiene junto a su papá un billar donde mucha personas llegan a divertirse y desestresarse de lo duro de sus faenas, allí vende colas, aguas, cervezas y ciertos bocaditos que ella prepara y con lo cual se gana para el sustente de sus hijos, su papá le ayuda con ese negocio.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar colas, aguas, y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 24 De Mayo canton is located in the Province of Manabí and the "Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo" communal bank meets here every fortnight. The area is known for it's beautiful landscapes and it's hard-working people who are farmers and raise livestock.

Diana lives here. She is 28 years old, separated and has two children aged 5 and 7 who study at school. She lives in her parent's house. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because it helps her to get ahead. Diana is a very good mother who strives each day to provide the best for her children.

Six years ago she opened a small bar in her house. There together with her father she has a pool room where many people come to enjoy themselves and get rid of stress from their hard work. She sells soft drinks, water, beer and some snacks that she prepares herself. What she makes sustains her and her children. Her father helps with the business. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, water and food to prepare the snacks. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water and food.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en: Liwayway is managing a piggery business in her village. She raises hogs, and when they reach four months, she slaughters them and sells meat around their village. Liwayway has been running the business for 10 years. Her income from the business usually goes toward allowances for her three children to go to school. Liwayway wishes for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to maintain the business and improve it for a continuous source of income. Having her business is very important to be able to continue sending her children to school to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells drinks and other foodstuffs. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks and foodstuffs. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her economic status. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is single and describes herself to be innovative. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services, which she has been doing for four years. Her primary customers are female. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Lydia requested a loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy salon equipment. Her business goal is to open more salon branches within five years. In the future, she hopes to improve her economic life.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, determined to earn a good income to provide her children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Lilia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With the PHP 20,000 loan, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lilia hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She wants her family to be always healthy and in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a married mother of six children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells maize, cooking oil and rice. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, cooking oil, rice etc. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a leading business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, cooking oil, rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes, tomatoes, cabbages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials such as red brick, guttering, iron sheeting, zinc sheeting and nails

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина порядочная и сильная женщина. Она воспитывает 3 детей. Тахмина всегда мечтала организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она 7 лет назад осуществила свою мечту, так как она организовала свой бизнес. Она уже 7 лет занимается купле продажей детской одежды и обуви. Она покупает оптом товар и реализует в розницу на местном рынке. Тахмина постепенно увеличивает оборотный капитал и развевает бизнес. Муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Тахмина хочет увеличить оборотный капитал, то есть купить оптом школьные формы и реализовать местным жителям. Сейчас все родители покупают школьные формы своим детям. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tahmina is a strong, respectable woman. She has three children and has always dreamed of starting a successful business. Seven years ago she was able to realize her dream and start her own business buying and selling children's clothing and shoes. She buys the goods wholesale and then sells them at the local market. Tahmina is gradually increasing her working capital and expanding her business. Her husband helps her with the work. Tahmina wants to increase her working capital and purchase school uniforms to sell to the local residents because all the parents are currently buying uniforms for their children. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni for this purpose and she awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is from Larena and has a sari-sari (variety) store. She joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. To help the family, she engaged in retail selling.

Analyn requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase more stock for her store. She hopes to increase her income so she can provide for the daily needs of her family. She is also happy that she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is a married father of two children. He describes himself as business oriented. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He also sells cereals to earn extra income. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a local area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 91,000 loan to buy a  motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy a  motorcycle

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married mother of seven children, ages 5 to 18. She describes herself as ambitious, industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 49 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa leaves to sell.

Fanny has been in this business for twenty years. 

In the future, Fanny would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa leaves to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him, as he was able to buy the spare parts needed for his tricycle business. His loan helped not just in his business, but also in the education of his children. His income from the business is assisting in their everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are working together to provide for their family. Aside from his tricycle, he also has a farm and a variety store for additional income.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Daniel hopes that his business will last longer and dreams to give his family a better living. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en: Linus is a married father of two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. Linus will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her challenge to be lack of enough clean water. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 56 years old. She is married; her husband is a businessman. She sells foodstuffs and she has been running a business for 12 years. 

With the loan, Venantie would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profit from the business will used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Adeflor

texts.en:
Adeflor works hard to support her family. Adeflor is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional frozen products to sell.

Adeflor has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Adeflor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen products to sell

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao  est marié et père de deux(2) enfants dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Il est âgé de 33 ans et  est plombier de formation. Mais depuis 2012, il exerce comme activité la vente de maïs, d’haricot et du riz. Il s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Dapaong au nord du Togo et  revend sous un hangar à domicile.Yao sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock de 71 bols de riz et 3 sacs de maïs afin de faire plus des bénéfices.
texts.en:
Yao is the married father of two children, and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. He is 33 years old and is a trained plumber.

Since 2012 he has been running a business selling maize, beans and rice. He restocks twice a month in Dapaong in northern Togo, and resells under a shed at his home.

Yao is requesting a loan to increase his stock supply with 71 bowls of rice and 3 bags of maize, to make more profit.

loans.use: buy 71 bowls of rice and three bags of maize

loans.name: Koudama

texts.fr: Veuve  et mère d’un enfant, Koudama est âgée de 49 ans et réside à Agoè. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation de première nécessité à son domicile. koudama s’approvisionne huit(08) fois par mois au grand marché de lomé et à Tsévié. Koudama sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son  stock en riz  dans le but de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter de plus son bénéfice.
texts.en:
The widowed mother of one child, Koudama is 49 years old and lives in Agoè. She sells general primary-need food products from her home-based shop.

Koudama resupplies eight times a month at the main market in Lomé and in Tsévié.

Koudama is seeking a loan to increase her stock of rice to meet her customers' needs and increase her profits.

loans.use: buy two bags of rice

loans.name: Damal Group

texts.en:
Abdirahman is a 49-year-old man. He has 8 children, 4 girls and 4 boys. Abdirahman is an engineer who has a cement-brick production machine in the town of Borama. In the photo, he is standing on the far right and is raising his hand. He is the leader of this group, known as Damal, which consists of 11 members, 7 male and 4 female. All of the group members have existing different businesses, and they need to expand their medium and small businesses.

Abdirahman bought the brick production machine in 2009 with $2,500 from Hargiesa. He produces from 700 to 1,400 pieces of brick per day. He produces two different sizes of bricks and sells them for $0.43 and $0.53 each, respectively, or uses them to build houses as he is an engineer. Now, Abdirahman needs to further expand his brick production, so he requested a loan of $700 from Kaaba Microfinance Institution.  Kaaba will provide him the cement and required materials as Kaaba provides its loans in kind.

loans.use: to receive cement and required materials for his brick production business

loans.name: Monossibe

texts.fr: Monossibé est mariée et mère de trois(3) enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et exerce comme activité la vente des produits moustiquaires. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et  la vente ambulante, elle revend dans les environs de son quartier de résidence. Monossibé sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock avec 3 cartons de différents types d'insecticide afin de répondre aux attentes des clients et faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en:
Monossibé is married with three children, and lives in the Agoè neighborhood. She is 35 years old and has a business selling mosquito repellents and insecticides.

She resupplies three times a month at the main market in Lome and from street vendors, and she resells in the vicinity of her neighborhood residence.

Monossibé is seeking a loan to expand her stock with three cartons of different types of insecticides, to meet customer expectations and make considerable profits.

loans.use: acheter 3 cartons de moustiquaires

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi  est marié et père de quatre(4) enfants dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Il est âgé de 33 ans et  est plombier de formation. Mais depuis 2012, il exerce comme activité la vente de maïs, d’haricot et du riz. Il s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Dapaong au nord du Togo et  revend sous un hangar à domicile. Kossi sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock de 4sacs et demi de maïs afin de faire plus des bénéfices.
texts.en:
Kossi is the married father of four children, and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. He is 33 years old and is a trained plumber.

Since 2012, he has been running a business selling maize, beans and rice. He restocks twice a month in Dapaong in northern Togo, and resells under a shed at his home. 

Kossi is requesting a loan to increase his stock supply with 4.5 bags of maize, to make more profits.

loans.use: buy 4.5 bags of maize

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be prayerful. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own a cereal store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 51 years old, married and has two children. Aside from selling of various commodities, Elizabeth is also receiving daily income from her motorcycle. Most of her earnings go for her daily expenses and to support the education of her children. Elizabeth needs additional capital to make her business grow and for the maintenance of her motorcycle as well. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy tires, wheels, and gas for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that both of her businesses gain enough income so that she will sustain all her family needs.

loans.use: to buy tires, wheels, and gas for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice is a married mother of a 3-year-old child. She operates a M-Pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add M-Pesa float (electronic credits) for her business. Her business goal is to open another M-Pesa outlet within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-Pesa float (electronic credits) for her money transfer business

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru:
Хурсаной 49 лет. Она простая сельская жительница района Вахш. У Хурсаной нет высшего образования, как и у многих сельских женщин. Она зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения скотов. Это у нее семейный бизнес. Муж тоже занимается вместе с ней выращиванием быков и коров для продажи. Они совместно начали эту деятельность 10 лет назад. Параллельно с животноводством они еще и занимаются растениеводством. У них имеется приусадебный участок земли, на котором они выращивают рис.
Сейчас Хурсаной обратилась за кредитом в размере 2000 долларов США для купли нескольких голов бычков. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить бизнес. Она ожидает поддержки.
texts.en:
Khursanoy is a 49-year-old resident of the rural Vakhsh region. Like many rural women, she doesn't have a higher education. Khursanoy earns a living raising cattle, a business she undertakes along with her husband - together they raise steers and cows for sale. They began this occupation together 10 years ago. At the same time, she works in agriculture, growing rice on a small parcel of land.

Khursanoy is requesting a loan of US$2,000 to buy a few steers. She wants to increase her head count of livestock and expand her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a few steers to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a pig-raising business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Eva is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adeliphine

texts.en: Adeliphine is 34 years old and married with four children aged between 9 and 15. All of them go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past four years. With the loan she would like to buy more rice, beans and potatoes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, beans and potatoes

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Geneva has been in this business for 27 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an dditional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a married mother of three children with ages ranging from 2 to 8 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells timber. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. Her business goal is to have a big timber workshop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a single man. He describes himself as committed. He operates a retail business where he sells jikos (stoves), boxes and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate supply. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of jikos, boxes and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of jikos (stoves), boxes and other items

loans.name: Kissinger

texts.en: Kissinger is a married father of two children. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a retail business where he sells mattresses. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more mattresses. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells baskets and clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of baskets and clothes. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of baskets and clothes

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to own a bigger boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda works hard to support her family. Eda is married and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Eda has been in this business for four years now, and also earns income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Eda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married father of two children, ages 8 and 10. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Asmicra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ASMICRA” iniciará el vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amanda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de zapatos, costura, confección de deportivos, venta de zapatillas deportivas, venta de humintas.
