El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amanda es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años cuando ella aún tejía a mano, en la actualidad y con el crédito obtenido se logro comprar una máquina y masificó su producción. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de los vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The not for profit organisation 'Asmicra' will begin their twenty third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Villa Tejada. It is made up of nine members and is directed by an executive board of which Amanda is the president. The businesses that the association's members carry out are diverse and include selling sweets, shoes, sewing, making sports clothes and selling sports shoes and humintas.

This loan will benefit the small businesses and business holders which Amanda is also a part of. She told us that it has been two years since she joined Pro Mujer, having been invited by a consultant from the institution who visited her at home. At the moment Amanda runs a business knitting jumpers. She also made it known that she began this business several years ago when still knitted by hand. After obtaining a loan Amanda was able to buy a machine so that she can produce her garments en masse.

The loan that she is currently applying for is to increase her capital (by buying wool in bulk) which she will acquire from sellers in Ciudad de El Alto and later after knitting the garments she will sell them in the La Paz markets. This form of work allows her to generate an income so that she can support her family economically since she is single.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Amanda responded that she liked the training sessions and the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Cotaña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COTAÑA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de choclo, venta de lechugas, venta de vainitas, venta de morrón, venta de durazno.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de vainitas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que el mismo era un negocio familiar, cuando ella se casa decide emprender este negocio para generar recursos económicos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abono por mayor) que adquirirá de los vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará para la producción de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The not for profit association 'Cotaña' will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Villa Tejada. It is made up of twelve members and is directed by an executive board of which Teodora is president. The businesses that the association's members run are various and include selling corn, lettuce, green beans, red capsicums and peaches.

This loan will benefit the small business holders, one of whom is Teodora. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, having been invited by a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. At the moment she runs a business growing and selling green beans. She tells us that she began this job many years ago as it was a family business. When she married she decided to take on the business to generate an income.

The loan that Teodora will take out will be used to increase her capital (to buy fertiliser in bulk) which she will obtain from the vendors in Ciudad de El Alto and later she will use it to grow her crops. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Teodora replied that she liked the healthcare that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser in bulk

loans.name: Benter

texts.en: Benter is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for selling. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a married man who has two children. He describes himself to be talented and bold. He operates a retail business where he repairs televisions, speakers and other items and also sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for eight years. He will use the KES 45,000 loan to buy electronic spares. His business goal is to expand and have other branches within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy with good health. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy electronic spares for his business.

loans.name: Helida

texts.en: Helida is a widowed woman who has six children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals to schools within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susana hopes for success and progress through her hard work in business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hogs and feed needed in her business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a married woman. She describes herself to be self-committed. She operates a retail business where she sells onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a married woman. She describes herself to be self-committed. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Karla Mercedes

texts.es:
Karla es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en La Tinguiña junto a su familia. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a su propia dedicación pudo estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas y actualmente está ejerciendo su profesión en una empresa Minera. Gracias a la calidad de educación y a los valores con la que creció, hoy es una persona de bien, ejemplar y su esfuerzo se ve reflejado en los excelentes resultados obtenidos en su centro laboral.
Karla quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que quiere comprar un juego de muebles (juego de sala) para amoblar su casa, de esta manera poder disfrutar con su familia de gratos momentos unidos. De esta manera, teniendo más tranquilidad al saber que su familia vive con bienestar seguirá luchando para más adelante poder abrir un pequeño negocio y convertirse en una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Karla is a young woman who wants to get ahead in life. She is 23 years old, single and she lives in La Tinguiña with her family. 

Thanks to the support of her parents and her own dedication, she was able to study Business Administration and she is currently using her degree, working at a mining company. Luckily for the quality of education and the values she was raised with, today she is a good and exemplary person, whose efforts are reflected in the excellent results achieved at her workplace. 

Karla wants to improve her family's quality of life, which is why she wants to buy a living room furniture set to furnish her home, so they are able to enjoy pleasant moments together. This means more peace of mind knowing that her family is living in comfort, so she can continue working hard to one day be able to open a small business and to become a successful business owner.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like block of ice, sugar, milk, etc.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like block of ice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 47 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing. Leonila has been in this business for six years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Josefa has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Josefa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: A 1,500 USD loan is offered to Teresa to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy things every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, sugar, salt, milk, bread, soap, shampoo, cigarettes, and water. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2005 with her own working capital of 150 USD. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Teresa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, sugar, salt, milk, bread, soap, shampoo, cigarettes and water

loans.name: Villa Esther Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ESTHER” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de construcción, venta de pan, venta de carne de cordero.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  panadería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años de forma independiente, ya que este negocio lo realizaba anteriormente conjuntamente su familia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The not for profit association 'Villa Esther' will begin their fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Virginia is president. The businesses that the association's members run are various and include a construction service and sale of bread and lamb.

This loan will benefit the small business holders, one of whom is Virgina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, having been invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. At the moment Virginia runs a bakery. She told us that she began this business ten years ago independently as this was a business that she used to carry out together with her family.  

The loan that Virginia will take out is to increase her capital (to buy flour in bulk) which she will obtain from the bulk vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell her products from her workplace. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Virginia replied that she liked the savings and the health care the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mema works hard to support her family. She has an ambulant rice vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mema is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her ambulant rice vending business.

Mema has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 65 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Presentacion

texts.en:
Ma. Presentacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Ma. Presentacion has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sandra Mae

texts.en:
Sandra Mae is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sandra Mae runs a rice and charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell. Sandra Mae has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Sandra Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sirley

texts.es: Sirley es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Sirley trabaja en un supermercado como cajera pero también esta realizando estudios universitarios Sirley quiere un préstamo para cancelar pensiones y adquirir material de estudio, sus padres la apoyan pero tienen muchos gastos, por eso Sirley que esta en buena salud necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Sirley is single, has no children and lives with her parents in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement that belongs to her family. Sirley works in a supermarket as a cashier but she is also studying at university. 

Sirley would like a loan to pay board and buy study materials. Her parents support her but they have many bills to pay which is why Sirley, who is in good health, needs your help.

loans.use: to pay board and buy study materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has a retail business in Larena, Siquijor. Given the distance from where she lives to the town proper, Grace took advantage to sell petroleum and crude oil. It gives her promising daily sales and has sufficiently provided for her family. She obtained a loan from Paglaum MPC and repaid her obligations in a timely manner. Consequently, she wants to increase her sales so she applied for another loan to purchase more liters of petroleum and crude oil to sell. Grace hopes to expand her business by opening another retailing outlet in her barangay.

loans.use: to purchase more liters of petroleum and crude oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seedlings for his farm and to build a fence around his land.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells eggs, sugar, bread, and milk. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with potential  and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, eggs, milk, soap, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have more varieties of commodities for sale. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, eggs, milk, soap, and other items

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a married man. He describes himself as self reliable. He operates a cyber café where he offers internet browsing and printing services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are students and teachers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of printing paper. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business. He also owns rental houses.

loans.use: buy more stock of printing paper.

loans.name: Zibola

texts.en: Zibola is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
This is Ariel. He previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that he used buy more fruits and vegetables. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for him to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ariel dreams of a successful and comfortable life for his family. He wants to give his children a good and quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more varieties of fruits and vegetables needed in his business

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
Crisencio is a  35 year old micro entrepreneur from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Marilou and they have children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Crisencio oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the *boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 50, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

Crisencio hopes to buy more units of jeepney and dreams that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

**All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc. Gina has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph aged 47. He is married with two children, aged between 11 and 8 years; both of them go to school. They work together in a same business with his wife, and they have a common goal to improve their business. He has been running the business for six years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy charcoal, soft drinks, sugar and beans. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, beans and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un hogar estable al lado de su conyuge, tiene un hijo menor de edad, posee casa propia dentro del caserío de Chorrillos, Distrito de Callayuc, Provincia de Cutervo departamento de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Carlos se dedica a la destilación y comercio de aguardiente, con una antigüedad de 2 años en el negocio, dicho negocio se ubica en su domicilio. Él solciita préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo, ya que desea implementar y hacer crecer su negocio, dado que al hacer esto su producción en la destilación será mayor y así aumentará su ventas, con lo cual aumentaran sus ingresos, mejoraran sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 27 years old and has a stable home alongside his wife and young son.  He has a house within the Chorrillos settlement, Callayuc district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in northern Peru.

Carlos distills and sells brandy and has had his business in his home for two years.  He is asking for a loan for working capital and wants to grow his business and increase his production and distillation.  This will increase his sales and income so he can improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to increase production

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is married and has two children. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a pharmacy where he sells medicine, which he has been doing  for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. 

Tony requested a loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more medicine. In the future, he hopes to be an independent business person.

loans.use: to purchase medicine

loans.name: Andromeda Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANDROMEDA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, taller de carpintería, consultorio dental, farmacia, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años al observar a su amiga que comercializaba ampliamente sus productos decide iniciar ella un negocio similar. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y necesita solventar sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The not for profit association 'Andromeda' will begin their seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Paola is president. The businesses that the association's members run are varied and include sale of cosmetics, a carpentry workshop, a dental consultancy, a chemist and a bookstore. 

This loan will benefit the small business holders, one of whom is Paola. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, having been invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. At the moment Paola runs a business selling cosmetics. She told us that she began this business five years ago. After seeing a friend sell a wide range of products, she decided to set up a similar business. 

The loan that Paola will take out is to increase her capital (to buy cosmetics in bulk) which she will obtain from the bulk distributors in the city of La Paz and later she will sell according to her customers' orders. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support herself financially since she is single and needs to pay for her studies.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Paola replied that she liked the health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 27 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Michelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Michelle has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Michelle aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 22 years old and she is seventh of nine children in the family. 

She is borrowing PHP 4,000 to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Mary Rose is currently in the fourth year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in Information Technology course.

When she graduates, Mary Rose plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Patricia has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Patricia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married and works hard to support her family. She sells vegetables in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Rosalyn requested a loan from NWTF for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is the age of 36 years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children; she is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to meet her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and for coaching class in the evening. It is challenge for her to afford the school and coaching class fee, so that she is doing a lot of hard work to run the setup of her house. 

She owns a small beauty parlor at home and her husband is doing a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, Sumera's beauty products are going to be finished and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Sumera has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan; she will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors, and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her business. 

She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y su hijo, él tiene 30 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la cual esta ubica en el distrito de Pomahuca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Pedro es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 14 años, El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizara en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción con una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own house of rustic material with his wife and son. He has been putting down roots for 30 years in the region, and he has very good references in the community, personal as well as work related. The community is located in the district of Pomahuca, province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca, northern mountains of Peru.

The work to which Pedro dedicates himself is farming, specifically the cultivation of rice with 14 years of experience in the field. The loan that will be awarded to him he will use in farming work, application and incorporation of pesticides and fertilizers, and manual labor for his harvest. In this way, it will help him improve the physiological, morphological, and production of his crops. Also, to have a timely harvest and as a result have greater production with a better quality product which he will have no problems selling.

loans.use: to use in farming, application and incorporation of pesticides, fertilizers, and manual labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man who has one child. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a welding business where he makes gates, chairs and other welding services. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy steel and other welding materials. His business goal is to own a welding machine within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy steel and other welding materials for his business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 59 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children now at their adult age. 

She has engaged in a buy-and-sell dried fish business for one year already. She is earning approximately PHP 1,500.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of dried fish for retail.

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her dried fish business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en:
Dinna is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 12 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be goal oriented. 

She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myra hopes to become a successful entrepreneur and she desires to manage other forms of business. She also dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Don Béni Group

texts.fr: Ngalesya est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Don Béni», entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des articles d’alimentation. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une maison d’alimentation sur la route principale de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un agent  dans une Organisation non gouvernementale (Humanitaire). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 cartons de jus, 50 fromages, 5 cartons des canettes sucrées, 30 pommes, 1 carton de Heineken, 5 bouteilles de vins, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Ngalesya is a courageous shopkeeper. She is the president and a member of  the "Don Béni" business group. She is a 33-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of four children who all go to school.

The client sells groceries. She sells her goods in a store on the city's main street. She started her business with funds received from her husband. Her spouse is an officer at a (humanitarian) non-governmental organization. Later on, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running her business for eight years.

This new loan will help her buy five cartons of juice, 50 cheeses, five boxes of soft drinks, 30 apples, one box of Heineken, five bottles of wine, etc. She would like to increase her capital and educate and feed her children. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for the empowerment of male and female entrepreneurs not served by traditional banks.

loans.use: buy 5 cartons of juice, 50 cheeses, 5 boxes of soft drinks, 30 apples, one box of Heineken, 5 bottles of wine, etc.

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha is 47 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, noodles, coffee, soap, shampoo, etc.

Merciditha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, noodles, coffee, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Maricel has been in this business for three years. She has requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell. In the future Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine Is 32 years old and married with three children aged between 2 and 7. Two of them go to school. She has been selling in a bar for three years. With the loan she would like to buy more beer such as Primus, mutzig and local beer to sell. The profit from the business will be used for the family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more beer such as Primus, Mutzig and local beer to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, aged 43, is married with five children aged between 16 and 8 years old, and she takes care of other six relatives children which makes them a total of eleven of whom nine out of eleven goes to school. Her husband is a farmer and she sells clothes. She has been in the business for 11 years. With the loan, she would like to buy different clothes such as trousers and T-shirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and the rest for whom she takes care of.

loans.use: to buy different clothes such as trousers and T-shirts to sell

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, tiene como actividad económica el cultivo de granos básicos, trabaja de manera personal en horarios de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, es un oficio que heredó de su papá, ya cuenta con 30 años de estar practicándolo, sus ventajas o desventajas dependen mucho de las condiciones climáticas; la familia de José está integrada por su compañera de vida e hijos, todos dependen económicamente de los ingresos que genera al realizar sus cultivos.
Comprará abono, insecticidas, semillas y pagara mano de obra para eliminar la maleza y acondicionar el terreno para la siembra, de esta manera dará un buen trato a los cultivos, espera tener una cosecha abundante, abastecer a su familia con alimento diario y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Su visión es tener una mejor situación económica para cumplir con sus compromisos, dar a su familia buena alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
José grows staple crops for a living and works for himself from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. This is a job that he inherited from his father. He has spent 30 years in this line of work. It has its advantages and disadvantages, depending on the weather. José's family is made up of his life partner and children, all of whom depend on him economically for the income that he generates growing his crops.

José will buy fertiliser, insecticide and seeds and pay for labour to get rid of weeds and prepare the land for planting. In this way he will be able to prepare his crops well. He hopes to have an abundant harvest to give his family their daily meals and deliver all of his customer's orders.

José's vision is to have a better financial situation to honour his commitments and give his family good food, clothing, health and education.

loans.use: Comprará abono, insecticidas, semillas y pagara mano de obra para eliminar la maleza y acondicionar el terreno para la siembra.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie  is a 28-year-old married woman with 1 child, who attends school.

 She has sold clothes for the 1year.  She will use the loan to buy more t-shirts and clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase the savings and pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: to restock t-shirts in her business.

loans.name: Assouma

texts.en:
Assouma, 32, is married and has four children aged between 4 to 10 years. Her husband is a mechanic.

For the past ten years Assouma has sold meat to the community. She is applying for a 666,666 RWF loan through UOB to buy more meat to sell. She would like to double her business, so she is going to reinvest her profits in the business.

loans.use: To buy meat for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different merchandise in order to start his own business of selling goods to customers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: A 600 USD loan is offered to Teresa to improve her business. Teresa opened her kiosk in 2010 working on her own. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like soy sauce, soy sour, fish, salt and biscuits. Teresa is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.  Teresa is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, soy sour, fish, salt and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Al- Islam Al- Rahba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Islam Al- Rahba. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Rafika is a 32-year-old married woman with only one daughter two years old. She is the leader of the group. Rafika lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The family lives in a very small house. It consists of only two rooms, a kitchen, and one bathroom. This makes the family feel ashamed and bored especially if visitors or relatives come to visit them in the house. Rafika says that it is very necessary to expand the house. Unfortunately, the income of her husband is not enough to make the expansion. For this reason, Rafika is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build other rooms to expand her house. Rafika looks forward to making her house more comfortable and spacious.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build other rooms to expand her house.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora previously requested a loan for 40,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Ma. Flora requested another loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Her profits from her business will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. 

Ma. Flora hopes that her business will increase. She only desires for her family to be always healthy.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Oscar Vertin

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 29 años, es soltero, muy conocido en el medio, por la labor de venta de cerveza. Vive en casa familiar con hermanos y tíos los cuales trabajan en diferentes actividades. Él es una persona con buenas referencias por parte de su familia y vecinos. Su comunidad está ubicada a 45 Km de Chiclayo, pasando Zaña con dirección a Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, y es habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Oscar se dedica a la venta de cerveza, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente, y también percibe un ingreso por trabajar como docente en una institución privada de Cayaltí. Él necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de una cantidad mayor de cerveza, la cual le reportará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia también.
texts.en:
Oscar is 29 years old, single and is very well known in his area because of his job selling beer. He lives in the house of his relatives with his siblings, aunts and uncles, all of whom work in different areas. 

Oscar is well spoken of by both his family and his neighbours. His community is located 45km from Chiclayo, passing by Zaña in the direction of Chiclayo. It is found in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The community is made up of respectful people who work in business, agriculture and cattle raising.

Oscar has worked selling beer for more than two years. He also makes an income working as a teacher in a private institute in Cayaltí. He needs a loan to invest in the purchase of beer in bulk which will give him a higher income, greater profits and a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk

loans.name: Lyndel

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lyndel works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a direct-selling business. Shel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sardines, spices, etc., to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business. Lyndel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sardines, spices, etc., to sell

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 31 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 6 and 8; all of them go to school. She has been selling arts and crafts for 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more baskets and shoes. The profit from the business will be used to increase her capital and to buy raw materials for making those baskets.

loans.use: to buy more baskets and shoes for resale

loans.name: Tubehoneza Acb Group

texts.en: Jeanette is a group leader and aged 31. She is married with two children aged between 10 and 6. All of them go to school. The group is called Tubehoneza which means “live well.” Jeanette has been running a butcher for one year. She wishes to improve her business through the loan. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats for slaughtering, in order to sell meat in her butcher. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business. In the future Jeannette would like to have a booming butcher shop, to the extent of three times today's inventory. In the picture, Jeannette raised up her hand as a sign of identification for the group members as the leader for the group.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for slaughtering to sell the meat in her butcher.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne, aged 40 years, is married and has five children. Her children are aged between 10 and 23, and all of them go to school. For 20 years, she has been selling items like salt, sugar, rice, and beans. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, rice and beans, for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more salt, rice and beans, for sale.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is 24 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She  requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rachelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en: Janvier is 37 years old. He is married with three children aged between 6 years and 7 months; two of them go to school. He has been working in a shop for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as soaps, salt, sugar and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business, will be used to pay school fees and for the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To buy more items such as soaps, salt, sugar and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene, 27 years old, is married with two children between six and eight years old. All of her children go to school. She has been selling bananas for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas in a large quantity. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas in a large quantity to sell

loans.name: Cherell

texts.en:
Cherell is 32 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Cherell has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business like flower pots, fertilizers, seedling, etc.

She has been farming flowering plants for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Cherell would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business like flower pots, fertilizers, seedling, etc.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, 30 years old, is married with two children between two months and two years old. They don`t go to school. She has been selling bananas for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for better future of the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.en: Emilienne is 38 years old. She is married with three children between 8 and 15 years old. They have completed their studies. She has been selling bananas for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and become a supplier in the future. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house and buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Djiguisseme  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOTOULA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec  MINATA, 2ème personne debout  de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 1 group are married women of an average age of 34 with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Kotoula, one of the villages in Ouelessebougou, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming activities in the winter.
This is their second rural loan from the institution.
Minata grows peanut and rice. She is the second person standing from the right in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds and to pay labour costs for the upkeep of two hectares.
She sells the production in the village after the harvest to a clientele of retailers and consumers.
She hopes to make an average profit of 195.000FCFA per plot of land.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with his daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MENA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec FATOUMATA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Mena, in Kolondieba, one of the areas in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their first loan.

Fatoumata, who is the first person standing on the left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and corn. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing two hectares of land.

Crops are sold in Kolondieba after the harvest to male and female customers.

Fatoumata hopes to earn 150,000 francs CFA in profit, which will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
SEYDOU  est un homme marié  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et 7 enfants et vivant dans une  famille polygame à KABALA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien ses activités agricoles hivernale. 
Il est à son  4ème prêt avec l’institution, les 3 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de SEYDOU, l’homme dans la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Seydou is a married 46-year-old man with seven children, living in a polygamous family in Kabala, one of the villages of the Bougouni district, in the third administrative region of Mali.

He has been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out his winter farming activities. This is his fourth loan with the institution, and the past three loans have been repaid in full. 

The selected crop is maize featuring Seydou, the man in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain five hectares (about 12.4 acres). 

After harvest the crop will be sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women. He expects profits of 175,000 CFA francs per growing season. 

This profit will enable him to repay the loan and manage the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Duralita [a type of fiber cement roofing material] to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 36 years old, married, and a resident of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Her husband is a seaman. They have two children, both in school.  Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last 2014 and had taken out her first loan. 

Now she is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more inventories for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities, and for a medical certificate for her husband. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of basic commodities

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita and her husband are engaged in a rice milling business. They have been running the business for seven years. Sometimes they collect rice grain as payment for their service to their customers, but most of them are paying cash. To convert her collected rice grain into cash, she sells the rice in their village. Teresita wants their service to satisfy their customers. With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for the maintenance of their rice milling machine. She believes that by availing the loan, she will make their services better and will encourage more customers for a bigger income as well.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their rice milling machine.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana is 34 years old. She is married with five children between 15 and 3 years old. She sells beans and has been running the business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standards of their children, for the welfare of her family and for savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 30 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Emy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Emy has been in this business for three years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old. He is married with seven children aged between 14 years and 9 months, four of them go to school. He sells shoes and has been in this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and buy food stuffs.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour for sale

loans.name: Om Adel Al- Wadi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Adel Al- Wadi. It consists of five women, living in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER from AMB.

Safia is a 52-year-old married woman and the mother of 11 children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest one is 19 years old, living with them in their own house. She is the leader of the group. Safia is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Safia's family is very large and lives in a very small house. It consists of a few rooms and most of them are small. This condition makes the family suffer from the unsuitable living standards inside the house. Safia and her husband always think of expanding the house. They have an amount of money, but it is not enough to make the expansion for the house. They need a lot of money. Also, the income of the family is limited. As a result, Safia applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build other rooms to expand her house.

Safia looks forward to building the second floor in order to marry off her oldest child this year.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build other rooms to expand her house

loans.name: G.s Villa Nueva#2 Group

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alfredo tiene 54 años de edad, vive con su compañera de hogar es padre de 2 hijas su actividad es la ganadería, caficultura y también se dedica a la producción de leche y a repastar novillos, cuenta con más de 30 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividades económicas.
Don  Luis Alfredo esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar ya que no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica en su comunidad y con esta inversión espera cumplir su sueño de tener luz en su hogar y  mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don  Luis Alfredo su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una estabilidad económica en el futuro junto con su familia con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños. En la fotografía están todos los integrantes del grupo cada quien en su actividad económica.
Doña Nilbia se dedica a la ganadería desde hace varios años.
Doña Leyda labora como maestra y también cuenta con su pequeña finca.
Don Israel  se dedica a la caficultura.
Doña Anelda se dedica a la ganadería y la caficultura.


Trojes, Honduras - Julio 2014
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 54 years old, he lives with is housemate, he is the father of 2 children, he works raising cattle, coffee production, agriculture and also works in milk production and grazing steers. He has more than 30 years experience working in this type of economic activity.

Luis Alfredo is requesting a loan to buy a solar power plant as he doesn't have electric power service and with this investment he hopes to reach his dreams of having electricity in his home and improving his income to cover family expenses and financial commitments.

Luis Alfredo's dream is to improve his family's living conditions and having financial stability in the future for his family, with the support he receives from the loan which will contribute to achieving his dreams.

Nilbia has raised cattle for many years. Leyda works as a teacher and also has a small farm. Israel works in coffee production. Anelda works raising cattle and growing coffee.

Trojes, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to purchase a solar power plant for his home

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mil Flores está integrado por tres socios laboriosos que han impulsado sus propios negocio con el fin de ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, este grupo es coordinado por la señora Ángela de 36 años de edad y soltera, es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años, tiene catorce ciclo de está trabajando con los financiamientos de la institución y uno de sus mayores logros es la superación personal que ha tenido además que ha surtido su negocio con productos que antes no ofrecía, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijol, aceite, pastas, pan, queso, leche centrolc, leche eskimo, jugos del valle, gaseosas, Big Cola, etc., una de sus metas a corto plazo es ampliar el local donde ofrece sus producto. Otro de los socios es el señor Carlos de 43 años de edad comerciante de calzado en los municipios del país, principalmente en los mercados capitalinos, y por último la señora María Teresa de 24 años de edad, quien en su domicilio ofrece el servicio de fritanga como es enchiladas, además comercializa plátanos verdes y maduros.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Mil Flores is made up of three hard-working members who have been moving their own businesses forwards in order to improve the quality of life of their families.  

This group is led by Ángela, a 36-year-old single woman who has owned a small grocery store for 3 years.  This is the 14th time she has received financing from this institution.  One of her greatest achievements has been the personal growth that she has experienced, along with the fact that she has supplied her business with products that she couldn't offer before.  

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, oil, pasta, bread, cheese, Centrolac and Eskimo brand milk, Del Valle juices, soft drinks, and Big Cola, among other products.  One of her short-term goals is to expand the store where she sells her products.

Another member is Carlos, a 43-year-old footwear salesman who sells his shoes is cities around the country, principally in the markets of the capital city.  

The last group member is María Teresa, the 24-year-old owner of a fried-food restaurant and vendor of green and ripe bananas.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, oil, pasta, bread, cheese, Centrolac and Eskimo brand milk, Del Valle juices, soft drinks, and Big Cola, among other products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marvin Josue

texts.es:
El señor Marvin Josué de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa, tiene dos   hijos  que dependen de él,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Marvin Josué tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 01 año a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y verduras, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que lo visitan a diario en su pulpería, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante.
Don Marvin Josué está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, agua, leche, café, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito  espera  mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio y suplir de esta forma su necesidad de financiamiento, está muy contento de ser cliente nuevo de Prisma.
 Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su  negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Marvin Josue is 34 years old and he lives with his wife and two children who are all dependent on him. They live in a community in San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. Marvin Josue has his own house and for the past year he was run a convenience store, selling sodas and vegetables.

His customers and friends and others who visit his shop daily. He is an enterprising man with dreams of improving his lot in life. Marvin Josue is requesting a loan to purchase goods to stock his store like rice, sugar, beans, cheese, butter, water, milk, coffee, etc. With the support provided through this loan, he hopes to increase his earnings and overcome the need for financing. He is pleased to be a new client with Prisma. One of his dreams is to improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cheese, butter, water, milk, coffee, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 26-year-old married man from Beddya, a village near Nablus city. He started working as a building contractor three years ago. It is a good business, and Jamal earned his experience from his previous job. A very ambitious man, he would like to improve his business and open a contracting services office. 

Jamal requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy wood bars and some construction tools he needs in his business. These purchases will enable him to improve his enterprise and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy wood bars and some construction tools he needs in his business.

loans.name: Marbella Group

texts.es: AL grupo solidario Marbella lo integran tres microempresarios emprendedores, lo coordina la señora Marbella quien tiene la edad de 43 años y está casada, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años con ayuda de su esposo y solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como es vanidad, rubores, delineador, tratamiento para el cabello, perfumes para damas y caballeros, colonias para niños, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, etc. Otro de los socios es el señor Francisco quien tiene la edad de 52 años y es propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio el crédito lo solicita para la compra de queso, huevos, detergentes, caja de jabón, aceite, etc., y la señora Alejandra de su negocio se basa en la hecha y venta de tortillas y nacatamales, el crédito lo solita para invertir en hojas de chagüite, mecate, carne de cerdo, flete de leña, etc. Es el segundo ciclo que estos socios solicitan el financiamiento para sus negocios con el fin de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Marbella group is made up of three entrepreneurs, coordinated by Marbella. She is 43 years old and married. She has a business selling cosmetics from her home. She started this business two years ago with the help of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy products such as compact mirrors, blush, eyeliner, hair treatments, perfume, cologne, children's perfume, lipstick, nail polish, etc.

Another member of this group is Francisco, 52, who owns a small grocery store in his home.  Alejandra's business is making tortillas and Nicaraguan tamales. This is the second time that the members of this group are applying for financing in order to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy compact mirrors, blush, eyeliner, hair treatments, perfume, cologne, children's perfume, lipstick, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 31 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children between the ages of 18 and 2 years.

Emelda sells farm supplies, a business she has done for the last 6 years, earning a monthly income of KES 2,000. She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 which she will use to buy sacks of dried maize seeds for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Emelda will be able to expand her business even further as well as educate her children. Emelda's dream is to become rich.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds for resale.

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.es: José, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una aldea municipio de Concepción del sur, Santa Barbara. Jose se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 5 años,  anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo de maíz y frijol.  El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con la Institución y es por 10,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su finca de café en fertilización y limpieza para mejorar el rendimiento de la producción.  Su plan es seguir cultivando café para mejorar su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old, and has a common-law marriage with his wife, with whom he has one child. He lives with his family in a village in the southern town of Concepcion, Santa Barbara. 

Jose makes a living growing coffee, and has been doing so for the past five years. Previously he made his living growing corn and beans. The loan he is requesting is his second from ODEF, and it is for 10,000 lempiras. It will be used to invest in maintenance at his coffee farm, specifically for fertilization and cleaning in order to improve his production performance. His plan is to continue growing coffee in order to better his standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizing and cleaning his coffee farm.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and married with one child who is in school. Editha works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Editha has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 38 años de edad, estudio noveno grado esta acompañado  y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad, los cuales estudian 5° y 2° grado su compañera se dedica al oficio de la casa.

Manuel tiene 12 años de experiencia en la agricultura, cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de yucay 3,500 de maíz, 2 tareas de frijolera y 3 tareas de pipianera este oficio lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de tener ingresos económicos y por la falta de empleo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para  comprar 10 sacos de abono para beneficiar su cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha y así asegurar la comida de su familia.
 

Manuel sueña con ahorrar y trabajar duro para tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Manuel, who is 38 years old, went to school through ninth grade. He has a partner and two children, ages 10 and 6, who are in 5th and 2nd grade. His partner does the housework.

Manuel has 12 years of experience in agriculture.
