He cultivates 14,000 square meters of yucca, 3,500 of corn, 2 tareas (about 140 square meters) of beans, and 3 tareas (about 210 square meters) of squash. He learned this work out of the necessity of having economic income and because of the lack of employment.

The loan that he is applying for from CrediCampo is to buy 10 sacks of compost to benefit his crops and to obtain a better harvest and thus assure food for his family.

Manuel dreams of saving and working hard to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of compost to benefit his crops and obtain a good harvest and thus assure food for the family.

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines. Jerelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional lumber to sell.

Jerelyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional lumber to sell.

loans.name: Fanny Gabriela

texts.es: Fanny, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada, tiene 1 hijo, vive actualmente con su esposo e hijo en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias y productos plásticos, este negocio lo tiene hace 2 años y vende en su casa y en forma ambulante, los productos que ofrece son sandalias para damas y niños,  vasos, platos, picheles, panas y otros. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de sandalias y plásticos para la venta. Espera  aumentar sus ventas y así tener mayor ingreso. Su meta es poner el negocio en una carpa en el centro del pueblo para vender más.
texts.en:
Fanny is 25 years old, is married, and has one child.  She currently lives with her husband and son in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida.  She works selling sandals and fashion goods, a business she has had for 2 years.  She sells from her home and as a street vendor.  The products she offers are women's and children's sandals, drinking glasses, plates, mugs, corduroys, and other items.

She has requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras (HNL), which she will invest in the purchase of sandals and fashion items to sell.  She is hoping to increase her sales and in this way have greater income.  Her goal is to set up the business in a marquee in the town center in order to sell more.

loans.use: To purchase sandals and fashion items to sell.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 43-year-old, hardworking housewife. She is a responsible mother and looks after her family at home. Her husband owns a vegetable sales business, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in their hometown over a cart. 

Now he wants to hire a shop for selling the vegetables; he needs money to open a new vegetable shop. For that his wife has requested for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. This wouldl help him to offer more variety to his customers, and he would not have any need to walk in the streets. Shakeela will save the profit amount for the future needs or medical expenses of her children. Shakeela prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking the loan. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to hire a shop to enhance their vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Om Asem Al- Wahda Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Asem Al- Wahda. It consists of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB. Nada is a 31-year-old married woman with four children, living with them in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She works as a housewife, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband works as an auto mechanic. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the necessary needs of the house. The house where Nada and her husband live is very old and needs a renovation and the doors of the rooms and the bathroom are very old and need to change. Nada's husband is unable to change the doors because his income is very low. He needs financial support. For this reason, Nada decided to help him in that responsibility. As a result, Nada is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase new doors for the house.

Nada looks forward to building the second floor in order to make the house more spacious and comfortable. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase new doors for the house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Jacinta operates a kiosk, which she has been doing since 2011. She requested a loan for $600.00, which she will use to purchase oils, beer, sodas, noodles, fish, and sour sauce. Jacinta is a hard working woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oils, beer, sodas, noodles, fish, and sour sauce

loans.name: Domingo Del Carmen

texts.es: Domingo de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos una niña de 13 años y 2 varones de 9 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como motorista del transporte colectivo, además los fines de semana atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de pupusas. Domingo desea mejorar sus ventas en el negocio de pupusas y ampliar la variedad vendiendo panes con pollo. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, loroco, aceite, maíz, harina de arroz, bebidas, panes, pollo, tomates, repollo, etc.
texts.en:
Domingo is 42 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and three children: a thirteen year old daughter, and two sons aged 9 and 6.

He is an entrepreneurial man that works as a driver for local transport, and spends the weekends attending to his small business selling pupusas (stuffed handmade tortillas). Domingo wants to improve his sales at his pupusa business, and also increase the variety, selling breads stuffed with chicken.

For this, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in pork, cheese, loroco (a vine flower bud), oil, corn, rice flour, beverages, bread, chicken, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.use: to purchase pork, cheese, loroco (a vine flower bud), oil, corn, rice flour, beverages, bread, chicken, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. to make his pupusas.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional products like peppers, misua (noodles), crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional merchandise which she then sells in retail. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ruth hopes to have more products to be added to her existing products. She dreams of having a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for peppers, misua, crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She  is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for three years now.  In the future, Lilibeth  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Asuncion is 45 years old, and has one child who is in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Asuncion requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Asuncion has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 26 years old and married with one child who is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell, like noodles, spices, canned goods, soap, etc.

Cristine has been in this business for four years. 

In the future Cristine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like noodles, spices, canned goods, soap, etc

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklace, rings, ear rings. He presents his jewelry in a glass display case to attract customers.  

He has only one source of income so he has to pay all the expenses such as utility bills, school fees for his children and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to standard for the family to live in. 

He wants to improve his house; for this purpose more earnings are required so that he can save some money to construct his house. Therefore, Raheela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can increase his inventory on a daily basis and increase his earnings as well.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.

Raheela is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She sells second hand shoes at the market both retail and wholesale. She serves all kind of people. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She takes care of additional family members. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes. Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality. She aspires to building rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Ester has been in this business for a year. Ester earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 47 years old and has nine children. Elenita is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elenita has been pig-fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
A married mother of 11 children, 4 of whom are in school, Merlita works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from farming rice.  

Merlita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Luduvina

texts.en:
Luduvina is taking a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, body lotion, oils, sugar and soap.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300. Luduvina is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, body lotion, oils, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is taking out a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy cement, sand and concrete block printing tools.She opened her contract in 2002 with her own working capital of $2.500.00. Rita is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and concrete block printing tools

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She has requested a loan for her husband's green grocery business. He has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now, he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventory to run his shop in a good manner.
 
His children are young and their needs are growing as well. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal vegetables in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. Maria opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working $500. And her husband is a farmer.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, beer, biscuits, bread, shampoo, shop and slippers. Maria is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business, after years of involving herself in doing business.  

Maria is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, beer, biscuits, bread, shampoo, shop and slippers

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee, a married woman,  works hard to support her family by  operating a general store in the Philippines.  Haydee has been in this business for 9 years.

She requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

In the future, Haydee would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Alleluya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kubiho est une commerçante depuis 10 ans, membre de la banque communautaire «Alleluya», senior  entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants, dont 9 étudient et 1 est déjà marié.  Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché pirate de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 140 poissons. Son conjoint est un agent de l’Administration publique. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kubiho has been a merchant for ten years. She is also a member of the group Alleluya. She is a dynamic, experienced entrepreneur, 49 years old, married, and a mother of ten children. Nine of the children go to school while the tenth is already married. 

Kubiho sells salted fish. She displays her goods at an informal town market. She started this business with funds she received from her husband, who is a public civil servant. She is seeking a loan with Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 140 fish. 

In the future, she wishes to expand her business and educate and feed her children.

She thanks Hekima for their support of women who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy 140 fish

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a Babban Gona farmer from Ung/Bawa. Ali expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Ali to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ali can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ali, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Ali will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Ali will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a Babban Gona farmer from Hannaiki. Abubakar is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Abubakar to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abubakar can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Abubakar is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Abubakar is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Abubakar will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tenemaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur TENEMAGA est né en juin 1963 à BOWARA, marié, père de 10 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à LOBOUGOULA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son premier prêt de production de maïs avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais,4 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare.
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau de village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000 francs CFA par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. TENEMAGA was born in BOWARA in June 1963. Married with ten children, he runs his own household as a traditional family in the commune of LOBOUGOULA, in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. He joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain his farming activities during the rainy season. This is his 1st  loan cycle with the MFI.  

Mr. TENEMAGA grows maize. He will use his loan to buy 4 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 4 jugs of various grades of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mr. Tenemaga expects to earn an average profit of 160,000 FCFA per season, which will allow him to repay his loan and the interest, and also to cover part of his family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Tunda Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her late 20’s, is single. She has been a food vendor for only eight months. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Janeth's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy rice, wheat flour, bananas and charcoal for cooking.  She cooks her food at her house and then takes the cooked food to the selling place at the marketplace where there are many people moving up and down. She is a hardworking girl. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Janeth will share this loan with her loan group "TUNDA" which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, bananas and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 41 years old and lives in the city of Gango, Ozamis.  She used to sell vegetables and offer transportation services to make a living. 

She earned enough to successfully  repay her previous loan that she used for buy spare parts of her vehicle. She began a new business which is to sell ready made nipa in their village; the raw materials are available in the area. She took a new loan recently to pay for the labor costs of making nipa.

 She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of making nipa.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Adelio es un hombre de 26 años de edad casado, padre de un hijo y se dedica a la pesca.
Él es una persona emprendedora, amable, gentil, honesto, paciente, buena persona, positivo y muy trabajador. Su  trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Puerto Pérez’ del lago Titicaca, a una altura de 3.810 metros sobre el nivel del mar. A solo 90 minutos desde la ciudad capital, este sitio es uno de los centros de acogida turística más destacados de la zona, porque cuenta con la mejor infraestructura hotelera y de comunicaciones. Desde esta ciudad se organizan los circuitos turísticos por los sectores del entorno del Lago Titicaca y sus islas.
Adelio es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su labor es la pesca y su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia; cada día él se dirige a su bote cargado de redes a realizar su rutina diaria, primero trata de encontrar un lugar ideal para la pesca, (la trucha crece prolíficamente en agua que tenga entre 58 y 64 grados Fahrenheit) enciende su motor y se centra en las aguas poco profundas si la superficie del agua está dentro del registro óptimo o en aguas más profundas si la superficie del agua es caliente.
Él necesita realizar la compra de un bote nuevo para mejorar sus ingresos, su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Adelio solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote de pesca y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelio is a 26 year old man, married, father to one child. He is a fisherman. He is a very enterprising person, friendly, kind, honest, patient, a good person, positive, and very hardworking. He works in the community of Puerto Pérez, on Lake Titicaca, at an altitude of 3,810 meters [9,843 feet] above sea level. Just 90 minutes from the capital city, this site is one of the most outstanding tourist centers in the area because it has the best hotel and communications infrastructure. It is from this city that tours are organized of the areas surrounding Lake Titicaca and its islands.

Adelio is deeply tanned, has short dark hair, and is of medium height. His work is fishing and his dream is to improve his family's quality of life. Each day he directs his small launch full of nets toward his daily routine. First he tries to find an ideal place to fish (the trout grow prolifically in water between 58 and 64 degrees Fahrenheit), he turns on his motor, and then settles in the shallow water if the surface of the water is in the ideal range, or in deeper waters if the surface of the water is too warm. 

He needs to buy a new boat to improve his income, his business, and his family's quality of life. This is why Adelio is requesting a loan to buy a fishing boat, so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Emerlinda

texts.en:
Emerlinda is a 50-year-old married woman with four children (2 attend school). She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store  in the Philippines and requests 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, soap, chips, coffee, eggs, and sugar. Emerlinda has been in this business for 5 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requests another loan to further build her business.

 In the future, Emerlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, chips, coffee, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is forty three years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a vegetable supplier by profession and has supplied fresh vegetables to a market in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to the retailers. He has been providing for his children and parents from the income earned from this vegetable business. 

The family's needs have increased and he does not have another income source to cope with these needs. He decided to expand his current business by increasing the stock on a daily basis.

Jameela requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy additional seasonal vegetable.

Jameela thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Evence Group

texts.en: Elvie is the featured borrower of Evence group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She and her group members have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines. Elvie is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four. She works as a housekeeper to provide her family with a better standard of living through the income from her current job. Life in the Philippines is very expensive, and job opportunities are limited. Elvie is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send money to cover her children's increasing living needs expenses, such as food, clothes and medicine. Elvie is the first lady standing from the far left side of the picture in the striped shirt. Esmeralda is the lady at the center of the picture, while Soflix is the one on the right.

loans.use: To send money for her children's increasing living needs expenses (food, clothes, medicine, etc.)

loans.name: Arcel 1 Group

texts.en:
Eloisa is the featured borrower of Arcel 1 group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends, since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines. 

Eloisa is a 45-year-old married mother of three who works as a housekeeper to provide her family with a better living through the acquired income from her current job. Life in the Philippines is very expensive and job opportunities are limited. 

Eloisa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send the money for her children to cover their increasing living expenses. 

Eloisa is the second lady standing from the far left side of the picture with the black and gold top. As for the other group members, Jacqui-lou  is the second lady from the right side of the picture with the white top, Floravel is the first lady from the right with the brown top, while Aileen is the first from the left.

loans.use: To send the money for her children to cover their increasing living expenses

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, personal needs, house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to meet her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams of growing and expand her business. She also desires to have a better house for her family. She meets weekly  with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en: Wesam is a 24-year-old, married man from Attel, a village near Tulkarm. He is a father for one small son. Wesam works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. He also has beehives where he makes natural honey and resells it in the market. Wesam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to expand his beehives and to build more of them. By taking this loan, Wesam's project will be improved and also his income.  Wesam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand his beehives and to build more of them.

loans.name: Delly

texts.en:
Delly is 50 years old and married with three children, one attends school. She has been a very hard working entrepreneur  in the clothing business for 10 years. Delly requested 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

In the future, Delly would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eva Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Eva Rose works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. 

Eva Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting an additional loan to further build her business. Eva Rose is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She hopes her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase home appliances and furniture for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to renovate the house and build new rooms.

loans.name: Lourenca

texts.en: Lourenca is taking a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is married and has four children.  She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, oils, noodles, coffee, water and biscuits. She opened her kiosk since 2010 with her own working capital of 2,000 USD. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Also, her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as beer, Sagiko, Fanta, oils, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old responsible woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with the Brac and first with the Kiva. 

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles. He purchases scrap goods and sells it to the recycling factories.

Due to household expenses, he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell.  Nasreen has requested a loan for her husband's enterprise to buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and save money to meet emergency needs.
 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and is interested in applying for additional loans after the payment of this current loan. She thanks  Kiva and their field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 44-year-old hard-working housewife. She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit selling business which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal fruits from the field and sells them in his home town from a cart. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling fruits, because as a hawker he can easily reach people as he is closer to them. The people like to buy fruits at their doors instead of going to the market. Due to the freshness of the fruits, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and at noon his stock comes to an end as it is all sold.

Kousar is receiving a loan for her husband's fruits business so he can buy fruits in more quantity and variety to sell. She wants to save the excess profit so she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fruits in bulk in more quantity and variety to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Rogelio De Jesus

texts.es: Rogelio de 36 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo del maíz, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Rogelio solicita un crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, concentrado y vitaminas para las actualmente tiene y asi poder seguir con la crianza y obtener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rogelio, 36, lives with his family in their own home. For several years, he has been raising cattle and growing corn. He uses what he earns from his sales to meet the needs of his household. Rogelio is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow, concentrated feed, and vitamins. He currently has them to continue with breeding and get a better income to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Wilber solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento, vitaminas, concentrado, etc. y así poder continuar con la crianza de cerdos, para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wilber, 46, lives in his own home with his family. He raises and sells pigs. His business is located in his home and his earnings from his sales are used to meet the needs of his household. Wilber is applying for a loan to purchase food, vitamins, concentrated feed, and more to continue raising pigs to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen has mastered her baking skills and perfected recipes for her bakery business. She recalled it was not easy to put up a business, especially when there is not enough capital at hand. It was a good thing though, that she signed up for her membership with PMPC and was able to access a loan. Recently, Belen applied for another loan amount to purchase bags of flour and baking equipment. She hopes to boost her income through infusion of capital. In the future, Belen hopes to open another bakery branch in the neighboring town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour and baking equipments.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a 45-year- old married woman with eight children (1 attends school).

She has grown flowers for 3 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer, flower pots, and seedlings.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, flower pots, and  seedlings.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, three attend school.  Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 3 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase shampoo, can goods, and soft drinks.

In the future Elvie, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, can goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 31-year-old married man with three children. His oldest child is eight years old and his youngest child is three years old. He lives with his family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied until secondary school, but he couldn't complete his study. Now, he is an employee with a small salary. This salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. His house is very old and needs to be renovated. Unfortunately; Mohsen doesn't have enough money to renovate the house. For this reason, Mohsen applied for a loan of 159,500 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate his house.

Mohsen looks forward to renovating all his house and to building another floor to make his house more comfortable and spacious.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials as cement and bricks to renovate his house.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin es un hombre de 50 años de edad, casado, padre de 3 hijos y se dedica a la artesanía en totora.
Él es una persona amable, emprendedor, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Huatajata’ que es una de las regiones turísticas más importantes de Bolivia, las condiciones de adaptabilidad de los pobladores al medio que les rodea, ha permitido formar una relación población-naturaleza, expresada en el aprovechamiento de las condiciones y los recursos naturales del medio (suelo, forestal y otros) .
Fermin es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua natal es el aymara el cual combina con el español para el comercio. Su labor es la artesanía en totora y tejidos en lana de alpaca y de oveja, toda la producción la realiza con materiales propios del lugar como la totora; que es la planta utilitaria del lago sagrado: ‘el Titicaca’, por la serie de beneficios que ofrece como alimento, medicina natural y materia prima. Su utilización tradicional es milenaria y aún se mantiene entre los pueblos de la región lacustre.
Su sueño es obtener mejores ingresos económicos mediante el turismo, realizando la construcción de una isla flotante de totora para exponer su artesanía y mejorar su zona turística.
Es por esos motivos que Fermin solicita un préstamo para la construcción de una isla flotante de totora y mejorar el turismo en su zona.
texts.en:
Fermin is 50 years old. He's married with 3 children and is a craftsman who uses reeds.
He is a friendly entrepreneur who is consistent, patient, responsible, and a hardworking person. His business is located in the Huatajata community, one of the most important tourist regions of Bolivia. The people adapt well to their environment and they have a good balance between people and their natural environment which is expressed in their use of natural resources in their environment (soil, forest, and more).
Fermin has a dark complexion, medium build, short black hair, and his native language is Aymara which he combines with Spanish for commerce. His job is to craft reeds and woven alpaca and sheep wool. All of his work is done with local materials like reeds which is a usable plant from the sacred Lake Titicaca which is used as food, natural medicine, and raw material. Its traditional use is ancient and still used among the people in the lake region.
His dream is to get a better income through tourism by constructing a floating island of reeds to show his craftsmanship and improve his tourist area. It is for these reasons that Fermin is applying for a loan for the construction of the floating island to enhance tourism to this area.

loans.use: to construct a floating island made of reeds to enhance tourism

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all attend school.  She takes care of additional family members.

She has sold fruit and vegetables at the market on a retail and wholesale basis for 1 year.  She earns additional income selling running water.  She works seven days a week. 

She has requested 2,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy quantities of greens, watermelons, cabbages, pineapples,and tomatoes. Her major challenge includes customers that do not pay their bills and weather conditions. 

She wants to  educate her children to the university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her major expense includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to  buy bulk quantities of greens, watermelons, cabbages, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
To make a living, Agustina helps her husband operate their own rice farm. For many years, the couple has earned well and it helps her family a lot.  Her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. Improving their lives becomes easier with their access to GDMPC microfinance, only if they work with determination and faith. To improve their farm, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer.

She plans to expand her farm in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya, age 39, is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including thread, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Suriya, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase a new sewing machine with the help of this loan.

Suriya is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 25 years old and married with three children, with one child in school. Ilyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ilyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: El Diamante De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia Silvia pertenece al banco comunal EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Silvia tiene 42 años de edad ,casada y tiene 04 hijos,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño
que le pone cada dia su negocio ,la socia vende zanahorias,tomates ,cebollas en uno de los mercados de la zona,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
Los demas socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante,materiales de construccion,ganaderia,crianza de animales,tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the "EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA" communal bank which is located in Urubamba district, the province of Urubamba in Cusco Department.

Silvia is 42 years old, married and has four children. She mixes her everyday activities with her business of selling vegetables. She has been doing this business for quite a while and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She sells carrots, tomatoes and onions in one of the markets of the area.

The member wants to continue to work in this way to support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase carrots wholesale. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the agreed installments.

The members who appear in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of obligations at work. The other members work in a restaurant business, selling construction materials raising livestock, raising animals and having a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy carrots wholesale.

loans.name: Melitza Esther

texts.es: Melitza es una microempresaria laboriosa, de 29 años de edad y soltera, su negocio es la hecha y venta de tamales pisques, los comercializa en su comunidad y solicita el crédito para la compra de quintal de maíz, hojas de chagüite, flete de leña, cal y sal, una de sus metas es aumentar la clientela para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Melitza is a hardworking small entrepreneur. She is 29 years old, single, and has a business of making and selling bean tamales. Melitza sells her products in her community.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a quintal (100 kg) of corn, banana leaves, a truckload of firewood, lime powder, and salt. One of her goals is to increase her clientele so that she can improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, banana leaves, firewood, lime powder, and salt.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Cornelia tiene 49 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, sus hijos son mayores de edad, vive en casa familiar junto a su cónyuge, en el caserío de Laynas distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Cornelia se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, comida, cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, con una antiuedad de más de 5 años, cuenta con clientela fija. Ella junto a su conyugue han solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera ofrecer un lugar más comodo y agradable para sus clientes, y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos a su familia, mejoras en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cornelia is 49 years old, married, and has (adult) children. She lives in a house with her spouse on the coast of nothern Peru in the Laynas district of La Matanza, which is in the Lambayeque region of the Chiclayo Province. The population there makes a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Cornelia makes her living selling chicha de jora (liquor made from corn), food, and beer. Her business is located within her home, and she has many regular customers as she has been open for over five years. She, together with her husband, is requesting the loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3000 nuevos soles in order to make home improvements. This way, she will be able to offer a more comfortable and welcoming space to her customers, which will help her generate more income for her family and better their quality of living.

loans.use: to make home improvements to offer a more comfortable and welcoming space to her customers, which will help her generate more income for her family

loans.name: Edson Ivan

texts.es:
Edson tiene 24 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia con cónyuge e hijo de casi 3 años de edad en el distrito de SAÑA, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la cual se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos y animales menores como pato, conejos, etc.

Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de moto lineal en la cual se movilizará de casa a trabajo y viceversa mejorarando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edson is 24 years old, partnered, and lives in his own house with his spouse and almost 3-year-old son in the district of SAÑA, in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, where he works raising and selling goats and small animals such as ducks, rabbits, etc. 

He is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a motorcycle on which he will go from home to work and back, improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing a motorcycle, with which he will go from home to work and back.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Josephine has requested a PHP27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. She has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a young and enterprising woman.  She is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). They are in school, in grade 6 and grade 2.  Her husband is a farmer and they both have elementary educations.  Due to the poor economic resources of their families, they could not go for higher studies. They live in a small village Vivekananda Pally in their mud and bamboo house.

Mamata's husband is a hardworking man. He is 35 years old.  His greatest motivation in life is his children. For them, he wakes up early in order to go to work and provide them with a better future with better education.  For many years, he has worked in agriculture, growing paddy on his land. It is going very well because he is hardworking, responsible, and offers high-quality products.  Now with his present earnings he cannot cover all the expenses of his family as the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds these days. So to cope up with the present situation, he wants to expand his cultivation.

Mamata is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS and is thankful to the investors because she will be able to buy agricultural products like fertilizers and pesticides in order to maintain her crops, expand her sown land, and increase her income via sales with their support. With her earnings, she will be able to improve her family's quality-of-life and continue striving for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Mariyama Group

texts.en:
Santoshi, aged about 40 years, is the group leader of the four-member Group of J.K.Pur, Rayagada, Odisha, India. Her family comprises three members, her husband and one son aged 3. The group member standing second from right with raised hand is Santoshi. 

At present, she has been sewing dresses of ladies for the last five years and became a ladies' tailor master in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts. Santoshi’s husband is assisting her to run the business smoothly by bringing thread, blouse pieces, buttons, etc., from the nearby town.  At present her family income is INR 4,500 per month which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti.  From the loan amount, she will purchase a sewing machine and stitching materials in bulk quantities. She has a dream to increase her business, stitch ready-made dresses, supply them to the market, and educate her children in a better school. 

The other four members of her group are doing business individually.

loans.use: purchase stitching materials.

loans.name: Serili Baba Group

texts.en:
Gousia, aged about 25 years, is the group leader of a four-member group that hails from J. K. Pur, Rayagada, Odisha, India. Her family comprises three members: her mother and one brother. The age of her brother is eight years. The member standing second from the right with a raised hand is Gousi. At present, she is running a bangles shop in the town, and has for the last nine years. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts. 

Gousia’s brother helps her in purchasing bangles from different towns, even from Raipur, Vishakhapatnam, to run the business smoothly. At present, her family's income is Rs. 5,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti. From the loan amount, she will purchase a bulk quantity of bangles from the town to save transportation cost and time, which she incurs by frequent purchases. She has a dream to increase her business by adding more stock of various designs and sizes, as per the need of a quantity to increase sales and add fancy items in her shop.

The other three members of her group are doing individual businesses.

loans.use: to purchase bangles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her small-scale poultry farming.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Industrious and hopeful are two words that describe Pramila perfectly. She is only 24 years old.  She is from Maynaguri.  She is married and a mother of two adorable daughters. She has a secondary education, but unfortunately she could not continue her study because of her parent's poverty.  She lives with her husband and daughters in a remote village in Jalpaiguri district.  Her daughters are too young for school.

Pramila's husband Ramkrishna, aged 30 years, is a farmer by profession.  He has an ancestral land where he grows vegetables.  To earn more income for the family and to provide a better quality of life to her daughters and husband, Pramila is also engaged in bitter gourd cultivation. She is a very hardworking woman. After managing her household work, she does her agricultural work.  Her agribusiness is a major source of income for their family.  Bitter gourd is a very common crop and it is used widely in their region. She possesses great knowledge about her trade. Therefore, she believes that she needs a bit of boost in order to increase her crop production and expand her business.

Pramila requests financial assistance from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can invest in the purchase of farming supplies such as seeds, manure etc. With this loan she will be able to continue her business and she hopes she will have a good profit to reach to her goals of providing higher education to her daughters.

She appreciates the favors of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivation of bitter gourd.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Grupo se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras  y está integrado  por  17 integrantes, donde una de ellas en este ciclo no retira dinero, están en  el ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan  ya que   se encuentran en el mismo barrio , se encuentran por encima de la línea de pobreza, o sea en verde, gracias a la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza y al programa de la fundación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Karina, quien comenta que pide este préstamo para usarlo en ampliar su negocio ya que  ella se dedica a la venta de sábanas, edredones, calzas , ropa interior y venta de comida con su madre los fines de semana  .A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su nivel de vida.
La Sra. Karina solicita este préstamo para la compra  de sábanas, edredones, calzas y ropa interior para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad de crecer que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (women entrepreneurs) and comprises 17 members, although one of them will not participate in this loan.  They are on their 12th loan cycle through the women's committee.  All of them work and help each other, as they live in the same neighborhood.  Their situation is above the poverty line, meaning their level is green, thanks to having participated in the poverty elimination survey and the foundation program.

One of the group members is Karina who says she will use the loan to expand her business selling sheets, comforters and underwear.  On weekends she also sells food with her mother.  Through effort and hard work, and her application of the vital behavior characteristics of a successful woman, Karina is improving her lifestyle.

The loan she is requesting is to buy sheets, comforters and underwear to continue with her sales activity.  She is grateful for this opportunity grow.

loans.use: To buy sheets, comforters, and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Dania Yorleni

texts.es: Dania Yorlenys, mayor de edad casada  con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en un taller de tortillas, tambien venta de frijoles cosidos y nacatamales, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de este localidad y en comarcas aledañas las cuales son al contado sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito los que recupera a diario, negocio el cual tiene mas de doce años ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio a trabajar desde muy joven, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y ella tenia que trabajar con ellos porque tenia otros hermanos menores que ella y esa era una forma de ayudar con un poco mas con los gastos del hogar, hoy en día lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, inicia su negocio con fondos propios, su jornada diaria empieza desde el día anterior el cual empieza a nesquizar el maíz para muy luego levantarse a las 4 am lavarlo y después ir a moler el maíz y elaborar las primera tandas de tortillas, luego las otra nesquizada es a las 9 am para prepara las tortillas del medio día y la ultima tanda es a las 4 pm  que pone la ultima nesquezada para preparar la ultima tanda de tortillas los frijoles los pone en la primera y ultima tanda de tortillas, los fines de semana elabora deliciosos nacatamales, los cuales sale a vender de forma ambulante o en su propia casa de habitación, uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de estudiar y ser todos unos profesionales, al igual que realizar ciertas mejoras en su casa de habitación para darles mejor seguridad a sus hijos, por lo que hoy en día Dania esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir en compra de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas como: maíz, leña, cal, gas, fósforo, bolsas plásticas, comales, hojas, achote, papas, yerba buena, arroz, mecate de amarres, frijoles, ajo entre otros mas
texts.en:
Dania Yorlenys is married with two young children. She was born in one of the municipalities in the north of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hard working and responsible woman, with a strong drive to get ahead. She is an entrepreneur and administrator of her own business, a tortilla shop; she also sells baked beans and nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). She does her shopping in markets in this area and in neighbouring regions; her sales are done in cash and on credit which she gets daily. She’s had her business for more than 12 years located in her house. She has regular and potential clients. Because of her lack of economic resources, she wasn’t able to go to university and she began working at a young age, as her parents were limited financially and she had to work with them. She had younger siblings and this was a way to help a little with household expenses. 

Nowadays she strives daily to provide her children with a better future. She began her business with her own money. Her day actually begins from the previous day, cooking maize. Later she wakes up at 4 am, washes the maize and grinds it and makes the first batch of tortillas. Later she cooks the other maize at 9 am to prepare the tortillas at noon and the last batch is cooked at 4 pm. The beans are put in the first and last batches. On the weekends she makes delicious nacatmales (Nicaraguan tamales), which she sells on the streets or in her own house.

One of her dreams is that her children can have the opportunity to study and be professionals. Also she wants to make some improvements in her house, to give her children better security. That is why Dania is requesting a loan to invest in capital for her work and stock her supply of raw material to make tortillas such as corn, firewood, lime, gas, matches, hotplates, plastic bags, leaves, achiote, potatoes, yerba buena (mint) rice, rope, beans, garlic etc...

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as: corn, lime, firewood, yerba Buena, beans, gas etc..

loans.name: Cordilleritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORDILLERITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cerveza, venta de abarrotes, venta de materiales de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cerveza; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que su amiga comercializaba ampliamente este producto en su zona decide comercializarlo en las comunidades del Departamento de La Paz. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza por mayor) que adquirirá de la ditribuidora de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen existe una persona por de más, ella es la prima de una de las clientas que quiso salir en la imagen y se encuentra vestida con una manta rosada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cordilleritas" will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Justina is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank run are varied. Among them are selling beer, selling groceries, and selling cleaning materials.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Justina is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, entering at the invitation of a counselor who came to visit her in her home. She now has a business of selling beer. She lets it be known that she undertook this business on her own initiative after observing that her friend was selling this product extensively in her zone. She decided to sell it in the communities of the department of La Paz.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy beer wholesale. She will acquire it from the distributor in the city of El Alto and later she will sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the loans that the institution offers.

There is one extra person in this picture, and she is the cousin of one of the clients (in the pink shawl).

loans.use: to buy beer wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De San Antonio Group

texts.fr:
Mujeres Unidas de San Antonio se formó en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, con 24 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas,  están en su ciclo número 2º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela, quien es ama de casa y está realizando el servicio de manicurista, por medio de este trabajo está luchando para superar su línea de pobreza, e ir, poco a poco, mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familiares y seres queridos. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que se esfuerza bastante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus productos, tales como algodón, quita esmalte, pinta uñas, limas, cremas, etc.  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Mujeres Unidas of San Antonio was formed in the city of Villa Elisa, with 24 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors. They are in their second cycle of the women's committee program, where they are doing a poverty elimination survey. One of the members is Mariela, who is a housewife and is working as a manicurist. Through this work, she is struggling to live above the poverty line and is slowly improving her living conditions and those of her family members and loved ones. She is a very determined woman who wants to get ahead and this is why she is trying so hard. She is requesting this loan in order to buy products like cotton balls, nail polish remover, nail polish, nail files and creams, etc. that will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: buy cotton balls, nail polish remover, nail polish, nail files, creams, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 35 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material rustico de dos niveles vive con sus 2 hijos de edades 14, 4 años de edad de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del distrto de Pucara, ella es natural de la zona nacida en el mensionado distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Edith es la venta de cerveza, gaseosa(bar), asi como picanteria; ella cuenta con clientela fija de la zona, pues ya tiene 7 años dedicandose a esta actividad, su negocio se encuentra ubicado estrategicamente en el centro de Pucara. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de cerveza, asi como también hacer unos pequeños arreglos en su local, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar sus utilidades y con ello su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edith, 35, lives in a rented two-story house made of basic materials with her two children, ages 4 and 14. Her oldest child is in high school at the national school of the district of Pucara. She is originally from this area. She was born in Pucara in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Edith's business activity is selling beer, soft drinks, and food. She has a fixed clientele in the area, since she has had this business for seven years. Her business is strategically located in the center of Pucara. Her goal with this loan is to invest in her business by stocking it with a higher quantity of beer, as well as making some small improvements to her business property. She will then earn a higher income, thereby improving her profits and her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business with beer and to make small improvements to her business property, thereby earning a higher income and improving her quality of life.

loans.name: Martha Haydee

texts.es:
Martha, surtió su negocio con variedad de mariscos, está compra fue posible con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, ha mantenido sus ingresos, sus clientes han aumentado junto con sus ventas, mantiene un buen record crediticio, su familia tiene un estilo de vida más confortable y equipo su negocio comprando nuevas hieleras para conservar mejor los mariscos.
Es la temporada en que se vende más el camarón por lo que requiere un nuevo crédito para comprar camarones, colitas, variedad de pescado, moluscos, etc., así tendrá más producto para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y el capital suficiente para realizar la compra, pues los precios en el mercado han subido, se mantiene trabajando para lograr establecer un local en el que venderá otro tipo de producto y reunir el dinero necesario para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha stocks her business with a variety of shellfish. This purchase was made possible with the previous loan. She has maintained her income, her clients have increase along with her sales, she has a good credit record, her family has a comfortable lifestyle and she equipped her business by buying a new refrigerator to keep the shellfish cold.

It’s the season in which shrimps are sold more and that is why she needs a new loan, to purchase shrimp, a variety of fish, mollusk etc... This way she will have more products to cover her clients’ needs and the sufficient capital to make the purchase as the prices in the markets have increased. She continues working to establish a place where she can sell other types of products and obtain the money necessary to expand her house.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, a variety of fish, mollusk etc... this way she will have more products to cover her clients' needs.

loans.name: Gioconda Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta tiene 42 años de edad, su familia la conforma con su esposo que  es chofer y sus 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos se encuentran estudiando, es una señora muy positiva con su negocio, son 12 años que Antonieta se dedica a la venta de ropa, esto lo hace ofreciendo a sus clientes y también vende bajo pedido, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar mercadería en ropa, la aspiración de Antonieta es seguir trabajando y por medio de su negocio tener los suficientes ingresos para dar la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonienta is 42 years old. Her family is comprised of her husband, a driver, and their 3 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very positive woman with her own business. Antonieta has been selling clothing for 12 years. She sells to her clients as well as selling on demand. 

With the money from the loan she will buy her merchandise, clothing. Antonienta hopes to continue working and have sufficient income from her business to provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is from Maynaguri. She is 39 years old. She is married and has three children (two sons and one daughter); two of them are in school, and the other one is grown up and works as a laborer on a daily-wage basis. They live in the small village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district.

Laxmi didn't have the opportunity for higher academic education because her parents could not afford it due to poverty. Laxmi studied till grade 9, and then got married to Prafulla, aged 49 years.

Laxmi's husband is a farmer. His father taught him to work in agriculture at a young age. Every morning he would go out with his father to work. He helped his father grow different kinds of vegetables, mainly bottle gourds. Now he concentrates on the cultivation of bottle gourds only, as they have a high demand among the villagers for their low price and nutritious value. He wants to cultivate more in a larger quantity.

So, Laxmi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will invest this loan in buying seeds, fertilizers, etc., to grow bottle gourds. The other part will be to buy the inputs to take care of the crop until it bears fruit.

She has a great desire in life. Laxmi plans to buy all the necessary school supplies so that her son and daughter won't have problems in their studies and can pass without any problems. Laxmi knows she can achieve this with the help of his loan. She also hopes that through the profit of the business she can overcome the hurdles and will be able to give the family a financial upliftment.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies to grow bottle gourds.

loans.name: Tapasi

texts.en:
Tapasi is a rural woman who hails from Maynaguri. She is a very young and energetic entrepreneur, aged only 27 years old. She lives with her husband, Khokan, and her three children (one son and two daughters). They are providing education to all their students, and they are in grade 6 and grade 1. Tapasi is uneducated and can only sign her name. They live in a rural village, Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district.

Tapasi's husband, aged 31 years, is engaged in a shuttering business. Tapasi acknowledged the fact that the income from her husband's business was barely enough to meet the daily expenses. She started rearing cattle to provide a good education to her children and to support her family financially. She purchased a cow and supplies milk to her neighbors. Despite her childhood being ruined, as she could not get a good education and only attended school till primary level, she never gave up her fighting spirit and became financially independent. She is a young, courageous woman who is willing to work harder.

She seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a dairy cow and increase her dairy business. One more cow means more milk to supply, thus she can earn more profit. With the increased income and savings, Tapasi wants to provide higher educational facilities to her children, which she did not get in her childhood. She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new covers and tablecloths for her social event business

loans.name: Las Ñustas De Quillarumiyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal LAS ÑUSTAS DE QUILLARUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ancahuasi,provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Antonieta ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 5 hijos La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
