The clients are members of the Las Ñustas de Quillarumiyoc Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Ancahuasi, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora María Antonieta. She is 43 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She works in her restaurant business, preparing different dishes, such as chicken with potatoes, soup, and stir-fried beef. She works from 8:00 A.M. until 5:00 P.M.  She has had this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the restaurant business. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members devote themselves to businesses such as animal sales, livestock-raising, a grocery store, and a restaurant.
The member thanks those who form part of this dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma es soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su familia y tiene problemas con las cañerias Emma trabaja como artesana y empleada domestica y necesita un prestamo para cambiar las cañerias de su casa Emma es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Emma is single; she has 3 children and lives in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement that belongs to her family. The house has problems with the pipes. Emma works as an artisan and also as a domestic employee. She needs a loan to replace the pipes in her house. Emma's work is the only source of income for her household, and she needs your help.

loans.use: to replace the pipes in her house.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children (two go to school). She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

Gorret operates a canteen at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week and serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Gorret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, soap, sugar, soda and cooking oil. She hopes to expand her canteen into a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, soap, cooking oil, and soda

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El socio Paulino se dedica al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Paulino makes a living through his agriculture and livestock business. He has a plot of land where he grows corn and potato. Paulino works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. He has been in this business for many years, and it is going very well. The member's dream is to expand his agriculture business. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Paulino is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the established repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio tiene 61 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región de Lambayeque en una comunidad tranquila, en la cual se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales.

Julio se ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales y arreglo de su casa, dicha inversión le servirá para aumentar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 61 years old, and he lives with his common-law spouse in his own house in the district of Cayaltí.  It is in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque Region. It is a peaceful community devoted to the raising and sale of animals. 

Julio has requested a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of animals, and for repairing his house.  This investment will help him to expand his business and generate more income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals, and to repair his house.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
Nicanor is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to utilize it to purchase an increased quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in his business. His earnings were a big help in his family's personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to take out another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell: the more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Nicanor's profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nicanor dreams of having a franchise for his business and of buying his own house and lot. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old, married and has 12 children, two in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying daily fare because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been cherishing his children. Now his children are growing old and have their needs as well. He has been worried for many days about how to abstain from the daily fare, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Ramzana has been making savings for many months to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband but at the time of purchasing, some money became short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  She hopes that now her husband does not have any need to pay a daily fare which has become the cause of expenditure. 

Ramzana is a 33-years old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She  hopes that now her husband would be able to generate more income; she is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Ramzana's husband to buy a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Shine Africa Group

texts.en: Betty is a member of Shine Africa group. She is a 40-year-old single mother of two children who are in school. Betty operates a restaurant located in Nateete in a market stall and has been in business for the last 10 years. She saved some money when she was working for a friend and began her own business. Betty believed that working for others could not generate enough income to support her family very well. So, she started her own business which is doing well. Betty has hopes of expanding his business. She has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 400,000 UGX to buy utensils and food items for the restaurant. This will help to expand her restaurant business. Betty is humble and hard working.

loans.use: To buy utensils and food items

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 68 años, es casado, conocido en el medio, por la labor de mantenimiento de camiones y cañeros. Vive en casa propia con conyuge, no tienen hijos a su cargo; su conyuge se dedica a labores domesticas. German tiene una familia unida y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de su vecinos, pues vive en una comunidad ubicada a 45Km de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; y es habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

German se dedica a prestar servicio de mantenimiento de camiones y cañeros, desde hace 20 años aproximadamente, además percibe la pension 65, y necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de maquinaria para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo cual le reportara mayores ingresos ya que podrá captar un número mayor de clientes y a su vez sus ganancias mejorarán, lo que le permitirá que sus calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
German is 68 years old and married. He is well-known in the area for his work in truck and sugarcane transport truck maintenance. He lives in his own house with his wife. They don't have any children in their charge. His wife is a homemaker. German has a close-knit family and has good references from his neighbors. He lives in a community located 45 km from Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. It's an area inhabited by respectful people who work in commerce, agriculture, and cattle.

German has been providing maintenance services for trucks and sugarcane transport trucks for more than 20 years. He also receives the 65 pension. He needs the loan to buy machinery so that he can offer improved service to his clients. This would bring him greater income because he'd be able to attract a larger number of customers and at the same time his profits would improve, which would allow his quality of life to improve.

loans.use: to buy machinery so he can offer better service to his clients.
